Ana is thinking of building a bigger house because her children are growing up and need more space. She also wants to get married to her current partner and to pay for her daughter’s studies, as she is the only one of her children who is studying.

loans.use: to sell seafood in the urban area of the city. She will also use part of it to invest buying corn, beans, rice, oil, salt, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, etc.

loans.name: Gloria Margarita

texts.es:
Gloria ha sido una persona muy dedicada a su negocio y dispuesta a sacarlo adelante. Gracias a este, es que pueda colaborar con los ingresos en su hogar y permitir a su esposo y a sus hijos tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad que la aprendió gracias a una amiga y con la cual genera los ingresos para su hogar. La actividad le ha permitido mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus 3 hijos y a su esposo y espera que su negocio siga creciendo para poder contribuir más a su desarrollo.
Gloria espera que algún día su negocio le de tan buenos ingresos que sus hijos puedan acceder a una buena educación universitaria, por lo que siempre lucha constantemente con el ánimo de crecer sus ventas.
Con la llegada de la temporada en la que se incrementan los ingresos para Gloria, requiere de la compra de más mercancía que le permita estar preparada para afrontar los pedidos de sus clientes, sin embargo, actualmente Gloria no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de ropa para tener a la venta para sus clientes.
Gloria espera que con el aumento en las ventas, sus ingresos se incrementen y pueda cumplir su sueño de montar un gran almacén en el que pueda generar empleo y contratar a personas muy necesitadas. Además, espera que cuando sus ingresos se incrementen, le pueda brindar la posibilidad a sus hijos de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Gloria has been very dedicated to her business and ready to move it forward. Thanks to her business, she is able to help with household expenses and help her husband and children have a better quality of life.

Gloria sells clothing, a business she learned thanks to a girlfriend, which has allowed her to earn an income for her home. As noted, the business enables her to improve her children and her husband’s  quality of life and she hopes that it will continue growing and contributing even more to their development. She hopes that some day her business will generate such good income that her children can go to a good university: that is why she is always struggling to expand her sales.

With the arrival of the season when her earnings increase, Gloria needs to buy more merchandise and be prepared to meet her customers’ demands. Nevertheless she does not have sufficient capital and hopes that a loan will enable her to buy clothing to sell.

Gloria hopes that her income will increase with a rise in sales and that she will be able to fulfill her dream of opening a large store where she can generate jobs and hire people in need. In addition, she hopes that when her earnings grow, she can offer her children a university education.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing so that she will be ready for the coming season when her sales increase.

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad is 32 years old and the father of three sons and two daughters. He works, but his salary is not large enough to cover all of his family's expenses. He is applying for a loan for $1,500 from FATEN to cover the costs of new furniture. His goal is to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, de oficio enfermera, tiene 63 años de edad, vive en  la ciudad de Granada, madre de dos hijos que ya son independientes. Ella fue a la escuela de monjas a estudia una carrera técnica en enfermería localizada en Chinandega luego la mandaron hacer sus practicas profesionales a la ciudad de Granada estando ahí consiguió trabajo permanente de enfermera en el hospital , hizo su vida se caso y crio a sus hijos pero se retiro . Ahora ella brinda su servicio como enfermera de manera privada en su casa de habitación. Ella es muy conocida en su vecindario debido a su experiencia y amabilidad además de brindar sus servicios a personas d muy bajos recursos que se les dificulta ir a una clínica. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de camillas, algodón, alcohol, gazas, sabanas, almohadas, pues son parte de los accesorios que utiliza para atender a sus pacientes. Una de sus metas es tener una clínica auxiliar bien acondicionada donde le ofrezca un buen servicio a sus clientes y tengan acceso a una buena atención médica.
texts.en: Juana is a nurse by trade. She's 63 years old and lives in the town of Granada. She has two children who are already independent. She attended a nuns' school in Chinandega in order to study for a career in nursing. Soon she was sent to the town of Granada to practice her profession. There she got a permanent job as a nurse at a hospital, got settled, married and raised her children, but then she retired. She currently provides nursing services privately from her home. She is very well-known in her neighborhood, because of how experienced and friendly she is. Besides, she offers her services to people of very low income, for whom it's very difficult to go to a clinic. She requested the loan in order to purchase stretchers, cotton, gauze, sheets and pillows, because they're part of the supplies she uses to tend to her patients. One of her goals is to own a well-equipped clinic where her customers can be offered a good service and get access to good medical attention.

loans.use: to purchase stretchers, cotton, alcohol, gauze, sheets and pillows.

loans.name: Carlos Anibal

texts.es:
Carlos ha sido una persona que ha atravesado muchas adversidades en su vida. Sin embargo, ha salido adelante con pujanza y con mucha dedicación a su trabajo y a su familia.
Carlos con 58 años de edad, se encuentra encargado de sus 5 hijos, pues la madre de sus hijos lo abandonó y es a el a quien le toca buscar diariamente los ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar.
Carlos se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un carrito por las calles de su sector. Gracias a esto, genera los ingresos suficientes para garantizarle a sus hijos cubrirle las necesidades básicas.
Carlos, ha visto como sus ventas se han aumentado considerablemente en los últimos meses, pues en los últimos meses no ha terminado su recorrido y ya no tiene más productos que vender. Es por eso que Carlos quiere salir a vender con más productos en su carrito, el inconveniente es que el carrito donde vende sus productos ya no le soporta mucho más peso, por lo que primero tiene que adecuar y hacerle mantenimiento a su carrito.
Sin embargo, Carlos no cuenta con el capital suficiente para esto, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a realizarle el mantenimiento necesario a su carrito donde vende sus productos, además de permitirle comprar un mayor surtido de frutas y legumbres para ofrecer una mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
Carlos espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, y pueda así ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Además, Carlos tiene el sueño de que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación superior, prepararse para obtener un buen empleo, y en un futuro tengan una estabilidad económica que los libre de tener que pasar por tantas adversidades como Carlos.
texts.en:
Carlos is a person who has weathered many adversities in his life.  Nevertheless, he has gotten ahead with vigor and much dedication to his work and to his family.  Carlos, age 58, has five children under his care.  The mother of his children abandoned him.  It is up to him to look for income every day in order to support the household expenses.

Carlos sells fruits and vegetables from a cart on the streets of his sector.  Thanks to this, he generates enough income to guarantee his children that he will cover their basic necessities.  Carlos has seen how his sales have increased considerably in the last months.  In the past months he has not finished his route before he runs out of products to sell.  That is why Carlos wants to sell more products from his cart.  The problem is that the cart where he sells his products will no longer support much more weight.  First he has to make adaptations and perform maintenance on his cart.

However, Carlos does not have enough capital to do so.  That is why he has the hope that a loan will allow him to perform the necessary maintenance to his cart where he sells his products.  It will also allow him to buy a greater stock of fruits and vegetables in order to offer his customers a greater quantity of products.

Carlos hopes that this way his income will increase considerably, and he will be able to give his children a better quality of life.  Also, Carlos has the dream that his children will be able to access to a university education, to prepare for a good job, and to have financial stability.   This will free them from having to experience so many adversities as Carlos did.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on the cart where he sells his products, and to buy a greater stock of fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ivania, una joven de 27 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, tiene un hijos de 2 años de edad. Ella se dedica a vender nacatamales desde hace 5 años. Este negocio lo puso debido a que su esposo tuvo problemas de salud y no podía trabajar, ella tuvo que hacerse cargo por completo de su hogar incluyendo el pago de los gastos médicos de su esposo, su madre fue su principal apoyo en esos momentos difíciles gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con este negocio que ha sido su tabla de salvación.  
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de arroz, maíz pues son parte de la materia prima que necesita para hacer sus deliciosos nacatamales. Los cuales sale a vender a las calles de la ciudad de Granada. Le gustaría tener un carretón con caballo para salir a vender a las comunidades cercanas y poder vender más y dar a conocer su producto en esas zonas.
texts.en:
Ivania, a young woman who is 27 years old, lives in the city of Granada and has a two year old child. For the past five years she has made a living selling 'nacatamales' (Nicaraguan tamales). She started this business when her husband had health problems and was unable to work. She became responsible for all household expenses, including the medical bills for her husband. Her mother was her biggest support during these difficult times. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has succeeded in this business, which has been her salvation. 

She requested the loan to buy corn and rice, which are some of the raw ingredients that she needs to make her delicious 'nacatamales'. She sells her 'nactamales' in the streets of Granada city. She would like to have a horse drawn cart to go to nearby communities and be able to make her product known in these areas as well.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn

loans.name: Losa

texts.en: Losa is 39 years old, married and the father of eight children. For the last two years, he has earned a living by selling baked goods to people who live in his community. He is applying for his second loan, for $1,500, to buy the ingredients he needs to make goods to sell to his customers. He plans to use his profit, which averages $104 a week, to pay his children's tuition fees. In 2010, he  joined SPBD to gain access to our financial services because we serve clients who are unable to borrow from commercial banks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make baked goods to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en: Toafa is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 10 children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling baked goods and specialty items to people who live in her community. She is applying for a loan for $650 to buy baking equipment. She plans to use the additional profit she earns from this loan to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to our financial services, because our organization serves people who are unable to get loans from commercial banks.

loans.use: to buy baking equipment.

loans.name: Clara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Clara, habita en la ciudad de Granada, tiene una pulpería, es madre de tres hijos, es casada. Su negocio lo inicio por medio de su mama quien era la antigua dueña de la pulpería, ella fue aprendiendo todas las tareas que a diario hacia su madre en la pulpería hasta que se hizo cardo por completo ella y se independizo de su madre. Ella ha ido introduciendo productos poco ha poco para variar y surtir su pulpería para hacerlo funcionar, ya que es el que le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos, su esposo trabaja como sastre mientras ella administra el negocio y su hogar.  
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de granos básicos, productos de limpieza, aceite, jugos, enlatados, leche, huevo y artículos escolares. Ella sigue con sus planes de mejorar la pulpería, tenerla con más productos, comprar estantes y vitrinas y ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara lives in the town of Granada and owns a grocery store. She is married and the mother of three children. She started her business because of her mother, the former owner of the grocery store. She gradually learned every chore her mother did on a daily basis in the grocery store until she took charge completely and became independent from her mother. She introduced new products little by little in order to provide more variety and diversity at the store, so it will keep running and allow her to pay for her children's education. Her husband works as a tailor while she manages the business as well as their home.
She got the loan in order to purchase basic grains, cleaning products, olive oil, juices, canned goods, milk, eggs and school supplies. She still has plans to improve the store, get more merchandise, purchase shelves and window displays and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, cleaning products, olive oil, juices, canned goods, milk, eggs and school supplies.

loans.name: Niuvai

texts.en: Niuvai is 39 years old, married and has four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a taxi business. She is applying for a loan for WST $2,000 to repaint her vehicle and buy new tires. She plans to use her profits, which average about US $250 a week, to improve and expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to our financial services because we work with people who are unable to borrow from commercial banks. This is her third loan from SPBD.

loans.use: to repaint her vehicle and buy new tires.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. She earns a living by running a tailoring shop where she sells and repairs custom-made clothes, shorts, curtains and pillow cases. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more of the materials she needs to run her shop. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 and hopes to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Denilson Gallego

texts.es:
Denilson se ha caracterizado por sobresalir en su familia por ser una persona muy trabajadora y visionaria. Denilson se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la actividad de la agricultura, actividad que aprendió por trascendencia familiar ya que su padre y sus hermanos se han dedicado a esto durante toda su vida.
Denilson es una persona que siempre ha querido sacar su familia adelante, por lo que trabaja fuertemente en su cultivo todos los días.
Denilson tiene un cultivo de legumbres, en el cual saca diferentes productos para la venta, y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, estos son muy apetecidos por sus clientes.
Denilson quiere que su cultivo siga creciendo, por lo que ahora quiere sembrar una legumbre más, por esto, quiere comprar las semillas, el abono, los riegos, entre otros; sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de las semillas para el cultivo de la legumbre, el abono, los riegos, entre otros.
Denilson espera que su cultivo aumente las ventas, pues tendrá más productos a disposición de los clientes, y con los nuevos ingresos espera que su familia puede tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
Denilson sueña con tener su cultivo en un terreno propio, sin tener que pagar arrendamiento, además, sueña con construir su propia casa, donde su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Denilson's personal trait has always been to stand out in his family for being a very hardworking and visionary person. Denilson has been in agriculture for a large part of his life. He learned this activity from his family, since his father and his siblings have dedicated themselves to it their whole lives.
Denilson is a person who has always wanted to get his family ahead, which is why he works hard on his farm every day. He has a vegetable farm where he gets varied produce for selling. Thanks to the good quality of his crop, it is very much sought after by his customers.
Denilson wants his farm to keep on growing and for that reason he wants to sow another type of vegetable. He wants to purchase the seeds, the fertilizer, the irrigation pipes, etc.; however, he currently doesn't dispose of the capital he needs to do it. That's why he hopes that the loan will give him an opportunity to purchase the seeds to sow this vegetable, the fertilizer, the irrigation pipes, among other things.
Denilson hopes his crop will get higher sales, because he will have more produce to offer his customers. With the new profits, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions.
Denilson dreams of owning a farm on a land of his own, without the need to pay for a lease. Besides, he dreams of building his own house, where his family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to sow vegetables, fertilizer, irrigation pipes and other supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Santos Melva

texts.es:
La señora Santos tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y tres hijos.

Desde los 12 años se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas, debido a que su mamá quedo sola y ella tubo que trabajar muy fuerte para salir adelante y por eso su mamá fue quien le enseño esas actividades como el cultivo de maíz, fríjol. Santos se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para dejar todo preparado en su casa y salir a trabajar, para llegar a su lugar de trabajo ella debe caminar a pie unos treinta minutos y trabaja unas ocho horas, luego regresa a casa para preparar el almuerzo. Así es su vida todos los días, pero ella sueña con dejarles a sus hijos una vivienda digna.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Santos es para comprar 60 metros de lamina zincalum, más de 12 polines “C”, más de 3 capotes para lamina y unos 200 pernos. De esta manera ella instalara el techo a la casa que esta construyendo ya que ellos están viviendo en una casa que no es de ellos, y con el préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de tener el techo, ella sueña con terminar su casa, pues le harán falta las puertas y el piso. Pero lo mas importante para ella es el techo lo de mas con el tiempo lo ira haciendo. Lo que Santos más quiere es tener una casa propia y segura para sus hijos cuando ella ya no este.
texts.en:
Santos, 46, lives with her lifetime partner and their three children.

Since she was 12 she farmed because her mother was left on her own and she had to work very hard to get ahead.  Because of this her mother was the one who taught her about farming and how to grow corn, and beans.  Santos rises at 4 am to leave her house ready and to go out to work.  She has to walk about thirty minutes and she works around eight hours.  Then she returns home to make lunch.  That is her daily routine but she dreams of giving her children a dignified life.

She will use the loan to buy 60 meters of zinc aluminum laminated sheets, more than 12 planks “C’, over 3 sheathes for the laminatd sheets and some 200 bolts.  With these she will install the roof of the house that she is building since they are living in a house that belongs to someone else.  The loan will allow her to have a roof. Her dream is to finish the roof at least because they also need doors and the floor.  But the most important is the roof and she will work on completing the other parts.  What Santos wants most is to have her own house that is safe for her children when she isn’t home.

loans.use: to buy 60 meters of zinc aluminum laminated sheets, more than 12 planks “C”, more than 3 sheathes for the laminated sheets and some 200 bolts.

loans.name: Mhark

texts.en:
Mhark is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single.

Mhark has a shop that buys and sells electronic loads (prepaid cellular phone credits) of several mobile telephone networks like Globe and Smart. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads to sell.

Mhark has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mhark hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads to sell

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Rose Marie has a shop that sells rice per kilogram. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Rose Marie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Rose Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Meziel

texts.en:
Meziel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Meziel is providing pedicab or multipurpose cab services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for the services.

Meziel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Meziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for the services

loans.name: Flordelyn

texts.en:
Flordelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Flordelyn has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Flordelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Flordelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Dennelle Mheygan

texts.en:
Dennelle Mheygan is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Dennelle Mheygan has a shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

Dennelle Mheygan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Dennelle Mheygan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Aleida De Jesus

texts.es:
Trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, son las mejores palabras para identificar a Aleida, una persona que siempre se ha dedicado a buscar oportunidades de ingresos y siempre ha querido que su familia tenga la mejor calidad de vida posible. 
Con 42 años de edad, Aleida se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son la motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días.
Aleida, anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar vinculada en empresas, y ejercía diferentes labores, pero no le gustó la idea de tener que trabajar tan fuerte por un salario tan bajo. Es por esto que entonces decidió montar su propio negocio de comidas el cual le generara mayores ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Aleida inició su negocio de comidas fritas, como papas, empanadas, entre otros, hace aproximadamente 5 años, y desde entonces ha venido ejerciendo esta actividad como método de generación de ingresos. Aleida, tuvo un tiempo en el cual no pudo trabajar mucho, puesto que su esposo se encontraba enfermo y necesitaba cuidarlo. Por esto, su negocio hoy se encuentra con niveles muy bajos de ventas, apenas esta recuperando la clientela y espera poder iniciar de nuevo.
Es por esto que Aleida espera comprar insumos para preparar sus comidas fritas, además de unas vitrinas para exhibir su comida. Sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de los insumos para la preparación de sus comidas fritas como empanadas, papas, entre otros, y la compra de unas vitrinas de exhibición que le permitan tener a la vista de sus clientes los productos que ofrece.

Aleida espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, y pueda así ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a las personas de su hogar. 
Además, Aleida sueña con que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de acceder a una educación superior.
Aleida también se ha impuesto una meta y es que pueda comprar o construir apartamentitos para arrendarlos y vivir el arriendo de estos.
texts.en:
Hardworking and dedicated to her family are the words that would best describe Aleida, a person who has always been on the lookout for income generating opportunities and has always wanted her family to have the best possible quality of life. 
Aleida is 42 years old, she is married and the mother of three children, who are her motivation to work hard every day. 
Aleida used to work for different companies and she did different jobs, but she did not like the idea of having to work for such low wages.  This led her to decide to start her own food business, which generated a better income with which to sustain her family.
She started her fried food business, selling French fries and pasties, among others, approximately five years ago, and since then this activity has been her source of income. Aleida went through a period during which she could not work very much because her husband was ill and she needed to look after him. Because of that, her sales are very low at the moment. She is only now recovering her clientele and hoping to get started once again.
For this reason, she is hoping to buy ingredients for her fried foods and some display counters to exhibit them. However, she does not have the necessary capital to make these purchases, so she hopes a loan will allow her to buy the ingredients to prepare her French fries and pasties, among other fried foods, and the display counters that will allow her customers to see what she has to offer. 
She hopes her income will increase considerably in this way and she will be able to offer a better standard of living to her family members. 
Aleida also hopes that her children will be able to access a college education.
She has set herself a goal: to buy or build small apartments that she can rent out and live from the money she gets from them.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare fried foods such as French fries and pasties and some display counters where her customers can see the food she has on offer.

loans.name: Abboskhon

texts.ru: Аббосхон женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Он очень старательный и трудолюбивый человек. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Он является бухгалтером в магазине «Армугон». Аббосхон хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия, чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях жизни. Аббосхон запрашивает займ для ремонта квартиры. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abboskhon is married and a responsible father of two children. He is a very diligent and hard-working person. His wife takes care of the household, while he is an accountant in the store "Armugon". Abboskhon would like to improve his living conditions in order to keep his family in a better home environment. He is asking for this loan in order to perform repairs in his apartment. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair his apartment

loans.name: Gloria Cirley

texts.es:
Gloria siempre ha querido tener un buen empleo y que este le sea bien remunerado, es por esto que desde hace más de 9 años estudió cosmetología y decidió montar su propio negocio.
Gloria con 32 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años de edad. Para Gloria, sus hijos siempre han sido lo más importante, y es por ellos por los que trabaja fuertemente todos los días, con el ánimo de brindarles siempre lo que necesitan.
Gloria ha tenido su centro de estética desde hace 9 años aproximadamente, y desde entonces su negocio siempre ha crecido gracias a la buena atención que ofrece y a la buena calidad de sus servicios.
Gloria, actualmente tiene una máquina averiada que le ha impedido poder atender a sus clientes con normalidad, por lo que sus ingresos han disminuido considerablemente. Es por esto que Gloria busca comprar una nueva máquina ultrasonido, que le permita atender a sus clientes con normalidad, sin embargo, Gloria no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de la máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a la compra de una máquina ultrasonido y poder así seguir atendiendo sus clientes con total normalidad.
Gloria sueña con que su negocio crezca y se consolide, de modo que le pueda generar mayores ingresos para su hogar. De este modo le podrá brindar a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 
Además, Gloria sueña con que sus 2 hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad y en un futuro puedan tener una estabilidad económica, que les evite tener que sufrir tantas adversidades como ella.
texts.en:
Gloria has always wanted to have a good job and be well paid and this is why for almost nine years she studied cosmetology and decided to open her own business.

Gloria is 32 years old. She’s married and the mother of 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. For Gloria, her children always have been the most important thing and this is why she works so hard every day with the aim of giving them always what is necessary.

Gloria has had her beauty center for about nine years and since then her business has continually grown thanks to the good attention she offers and good quality of her services.

Gloria currently has a damaged machine that has prevented her from being able to assist her clients as she normally does, and this is why her income has decreased considerably. This is why Gloria is looking to buy a new ultrasound machine that will permit her to assist her customers as normal, however, Gloria does not have sufficient funds in order to by a machine, which is why she is hoping for a loan which will permit her to agree to buy an ultrasound machine, and thus be able to continue serving her clients as normal.

Gloria’s dream is that her business grows and strengthens, and she can generate higher income for her home. In this way she can provide her husband and two children a better quality of life. Furthermore, Gloria’s dream is that her two children obtain a good quality education and in the future they can have financial stability, to prevent them from suffering as many hardships as her.

loans.use: to buy an ultrasound machine for her beauty center as the one she has is broken and needs to be changed

loans.name: Lidia Veronica

texts.es: Lidia Veronica,de 44 años de edad ella tiene mas de 23 años de obtener su negocio gracias a los consejos de su mama ella se dedica a la venta de fantacia ella hacia pedidos de sus clientes y ahora vende oro y plata en diferentes diceños,despues de la separacion de su esposo jamas sus hijos la dejaron sola siempre la apoyaron,en sus negocio actual mente solo una hija es la que vive con ella y le ayuda economicamente ya que esta trabajando el lugar donde vive es muy bonito porque hay muchos arboles y no hay mucha contaminacion de umo de vehiculos,a pesar de sus 44 no se cansa de caminar de casa en casa afreciendo su mercaderia,y seguira aciendolo hasta donde se pueda su sueño es ser una gran distribuidora de este producto y ayudar a las demas madres que estan luchando para salir adelante,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de oro y plata en diferentes negocios.
texts.en: Lidia Veronica is 44 years old. Over 23 years ago, she started her business thanks to the advice she got from her mother. She sells costume jewelry. She took orders from her customers and now she sells gold and silver in different designs. After she separated from her husband, her children never left her alone and have always supported her business. Only one daughter currently lives with her and helps her financially, because she's working. The place where she lives is beautiful because there are many trees and there's not much pollution from car fumes. In spite of her age, she doesn't get tired of walking from door to door offering her merchandise, and she will continue to do so for as long as she can. Her dream is to be a big distributor of these products and to help other mothers who strive to get ahead. She requests this loan in order to purchase gold and silver in different designs.

loans.use: to purchase different designs of gold and silver jewelry.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel,de 36 años de edad,se dedica a la venta de tortillas y ademas tiene su tienda aun tiene 2 hijos a su cargo pero su esposo jamas la a dejado sola siempre la a apoyado en su negocio,ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz para la elavoracion de tortillas,y compra de mercaderia para su negocio,y asi seguir con su negocio y anseñarles a sus hios que el estudio es bueno pero aprender un negocio tambien les ayuda para un futuro.agradece a Dios por el apoyo y a Kiva por la oportunidad de un credito.
texts.en: Isabel, who is 36 years old, sells tortillas and also has a store. She still has two children in her care, but her husband has never left her on her own, he has always helped her in her business. She is applying to us for this loan to buy corn to make tortillas and to buy merchandise for her business. Then she will be able to continue with her business and teach her children that studying is good but learning a business will also help them for the future. She is grateful to God for his support and to Kiva for the opportunity to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas and to buy merchandise for her store

location.town: Vosquez de Vista Hermosa,San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Tawfeeq

texts.en:
Tawfeeq, 44 years old and married, supports a family of six members.

After his retirement from the military, Tawfeeq opened a store for selling home products as shown in the photo. It has been open three years already. Today Tawfeeq has applied for a loan to buy more products that are not available at the store so he can have the item required most at any house.

loans.use: To buy more home products for the store.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es: Maria Catalina,de 31 años de edad tiene 3 hijos varones ella nos cuenta que lleva ya varios años de cultivar la tierra junto con su esposo,don Emilio y doña Cata como les llamas en su comunidad ellos se dedican al cultivo de ejotes,arbeja china,etc estos son los productos que ellos siembran.doña cata nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono y semillas,ya que tiene una gran parte en siembras pero aun le hace falta ya que lo que ella anhela es agrandar mas su cultivo,el mayor sueño de ella es enseñarles a sus hijos el cultivo paraque ellos a parte de estudiar aprendan a superarse trabajando como ellos lo hacen en el cultivo,espera que fape les pueda ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Maria Catalina is 31 years old and she has three sons. She tells us that she has spent many years farming the land. Together with her husband, Emilio, Cata (as she is know in her community) makes a living growing green beans, snow peas, etc. These are the things they plant. 

Cata is requesting this loan to buy manure and seeds. She has a large portion planted already but it is lacking still as she hopes to increase her farm.

Her biggest dream is to teach her children how to farm so that in addition to studying they will learn to improve themselves working as they did in the farm. She hopes that FAPE can help her with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Lucia operates a shop that sells firewood. She has had this business for 6 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 23,000 to increase her stock of firewood for sale. Lucia has been a member of Kiva's partner, HSPFI, since 2005.  In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Maribeth has a shop that sells rice by the kilogram. She has had this business for 2 years. 

Maribeth requested a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy more sacks of rice for sale. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, HSPFI, since 2009. In the future she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice for resale

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es: Eugenia, de 52 años de edad ella lleva ya 25 años de estar viuda,desde muy temprano saco adelante a sus 6 hijos hoy en dia ya solo tiene a 3 a su cargo que haun todavia estan estudiando,ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el municipio de San Bartolome,los dias de mercado que son:Lunes,Miercoles,y Sabado el resto de los dias atiende su tienda que esta en su domicilio,en donde aparte de atender su negocio atiende su hogar,y mantiene a sus animales ella nos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de frutas y verduras,y asi tener un poco mas de capital para trabajar.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 52 years old and has been a widow for the past 25 years. Very early on she helped her six children get ahead. Currently just three of them are under her care and still studying. 

She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables in the municipality of San Bartolome on market days which are Monday, Wednesday and Saturday. On the other days she runs her store which is located in her home. There she not only runs the store but also tends to her house and takes care of her animals. 

She is requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables and in that way have a little more capital to work with.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Creselda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

Creselda requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, HSPFI, since 2011. In the future, Creselda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale

loans.name: Karuma Move Together. Group

texts.en:
Hellen is a 41-year-old married woman with four children living in a semi-permanent house in Masindi, Uganda. Her goal is to educate her children to the university level and also to build a permanent house. For 13 years she has been running a drugstore. She started with 200,000 shillings but now has 2,000,000 as working capital.

She has challenges with limited funds to buy the necessary drugs required by the market and her dream is to own a pharmacy. Hellen is requesting this loan to buy more drugs for her drugstore. She is a member of the above mentioned group where each guarantees the other in accessing the loan.

loans.use: to buy drugs for her drugstore

loans.name: Maria Floritcelda

texts.es: La señora Maria Floritcelda,de 31 años de edad casada y tiene 4 hijos ella se dedica a la elavoracion de guipiles tambien de la misma manera cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan a la elavoracion de guipiles,ya que tiene entregos fijos,se dedico a este negocio ya que se vio la nececidad de ayudar a su esposo en la economia del hogar ya que su esposo es Pastor de una iglecia evangelica,y como tiene cuatro hijos quieren darles estudio.para que el dia de mañana tengan una mejor vida,tambien con el negocio tiene la oportunidad de ayudar a otras personas a darles un trabajo por esa razon nececita otro credito para la compra de materia prima para seguir con su negocio,agradese a Fape y Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Maria Floritcelda is 31 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living making huipiles [traditional blouses worn by Maya women]. She also has two people that help her in making the huipiles because she already has orders to deliver. 

She started making a living this way because she saw that she needed to help her husband with the household expenses because her husband is a pastor in the evangelical church. As they have four children, they want to let them study so that in the future they will have a better life. The business also gives her the opportunity to help others, to give them a job. This is why she needs another loan, to buy raw materials to continue with her business. 

She thanks FAPE and Kiva for the help they offer.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making traditional weavings.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayen is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for resale.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is a 40-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Roda is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase more fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Deiver Fernando

texts.es:
Deiver es una persona que se ha caracterizado por trabajar fuertemente gran parte de su vida. Casado, y con un hijo de 11 años, Deiver se dedica a la actividad de mayordomo en una finca cercana a su vivienda, y de manera independiente tiene ganado que le produce unos ingresos extras. 
Deiver sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una buena educación, además, quiere que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida que la que pueden obtener actualmente. 
Deiver ha criado ganado mucho tiempo, y gracias  a la experiencia que ha adquirido, sus ganados son reconocidos por su buena calidad.
Deiver actualmente tiene unos ganados los cuales ya los tiene vendidos en un pacto que hizo con un cliente, por lo que necesita comenzar a criar unos nuevos. Es por esto que Deiver busca la compra de dichos ganados para comenzar su crianza, sin embargo, Deiver no cuenta con el capital suficiente actualmente, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de el ganado para su crianza y poder venderlos a sus clientes en una buena calidad.

Deiver espera que su negocio no se vea parado, sino que siga adelante incrementando sus ventas. De este modo podrá seguir generando los suficientes ingresos como para brindarle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deiver is a person who is characterized by having worked hard for a great part of his life. Married, and with an 11-year-old son, Deiver works as a foreman at an estate that is close to his house. He also works independently - he has livestock that produce some extra income for him. Deiver dreams that his son can have access to a good education. In addition, he wants his family to have a better quality of life than that which they can obtain now.

Deiver has raised livestock for a long time, and thanks to the experience that he has acquired, his cattle are known for their good quality. Deiver now has some cattle which he has already sold through an agreement that he made with a customer. For this reason, he needs to begin raising some new ones. This is why Deiver is looking to purchase these new cattle to begin raising them; nevertheless, he doesn't have sufficient capital now, so he hopes that a loan will offer him the possibility of buying the cattle to raise them and be able to sell a good quality product to his customers.

Deiver hopes that his business will not end, but that he can continue increasing his sales. In this way, he will be able to continue generating sufficient income to offer his son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en:
Azhar is 24 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her family in Iraq.

Azhar has been a tailor since 2005. She professionally makes, repairs, and alters clothing such as suits, coats and trousers for women. She has more than four years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of the local customers and their needs. She has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

She decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to purchase two sewing machines and a generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s way of life.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines and a generator.

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Gladis ha sido una persona que ha pasado por muchas adversidades en su vida. Anteriormente vivía con su esposo y los ingresos no eran suficientes para poderse brindar una buena calidad de vida; ahora, su esposo la abandonó y ella quedó como una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo, al cual le debe brindar todo lo que necesita.
Gladis desde que fue abandonada por su esposo ha ido rebuscando sus ingresos en diferentes actividades.
Actualmente, realiza el trabajo de manicure (pintar uñas) a las personas del sector. Aprendió viendo a la persona que le arreglaba las uñas a ella, y entonces comenzó a hacerle el manicure a las personas de su familia, y poco a poco se fue consiguiendo nuevos clientes hasta el punto de tener hoy una gran cantidad de clientes.
Gladis ha visto como sus ingresos han aumentado, gran parte de esto debido a la buena calidad de sus servicios, sin embargo, presenta algunos inconvenientes que espera superar muy pronto.
Gladis no cuenta con muchas herramientas de trabajo, además, sus clientes constantemente le piden que les venda algunos de sus esmaltes para uñas. Es por esto que Gladis quiere comprar más herramientas de trabajo y productos que les pueda vender a sus clientes; sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de belleza como esmaltes para uñas, y algunas herramientas de trabajo. 
Gladis espera que sus ventas se aumenten considerablemente, y de esta manera su hijo pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
Gladis aspira a que su hijo pueda ingresar en un futuro a una educación universitaria que le permita conseguir un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Gladis is a person who has gone through many adversities in life. Formerly when she lived with her husband their income was not sufficient enough to provide a good quality of life. Now, her husband has abandoned her and she is a single mother head of household with a son. She wants to give him all that he needs. Since being abandoned, Gladis has been casting about for ways to make a living. 

Currently she gives manicures to people in her area. She learned by watching the person who did her nails and then began giving manicures to family members and little by little started attracting new customers until she reached the point where today she has a large client base. Gladis has seen how her income has increased in great part due to the fine quality of the service she provides; nevertheless there are a few inconveniences which she hopes to overcome very quickly.

Gladis does not own many manicure tools and her customers also constantly ask her to sell them some of the nail polish she uses. Consequently, she wants to buy more work equipment and also products that she can sell to her clients. However, she lacks sufficient capital and hopes that a loan will provide a way to purchase beauty products such as nail polish and some work implements. 

Gladis hopes that her sales will expand considerably and that in this way her son will be able to enjoy a better quality of life. She aspires to seeing her son attend the university in the future which will enable him to obtain a well-paying  job.

loans.use: to buy work tools for her business and to purchase beauty products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah, 53 years old, is a single man who faced the fact that he is handicapped and looked for a strong point a long time ago. Kefah found that he likes to draw and he is good at it. He also started to make wooden toys for himself when he was young and he was good at that too. After growing up, he decided to dedicate all his power and energy to the work of making crafts, wooden crafts in specific. He even enhanced the equipment he needed in a way that could fit with his disability.

It has been 36 years since he started professionally working as a carpenter or wooden crafty man. During these years, he participated in many exhibitions, sold a lot of handmade pieces and even won a prize in one of the competitions that occurred in Jordan.
 
Today Kefah has applied for a loan to work on fixing a few tools and to buy new ones to continue making those beautiful wooden crafts like the vases shown in the photo.

loans.use: to fix his tools and buy new ones to make his wooden crafts

loans.name: Arout

texts.en:
Arout is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has been operating a business selling food from a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Arout is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for her food stall.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Amer is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase more clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Akuch

texts.en:
Akuch is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akuch is requesting this loan through Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, 53 years old, is a married woman. She still has three single sons who are living with her in the same house. Her husband works in the construction field. 

To be able to help her husband support the family, Maryam started her own small business a year ago by opening a mini-market for selling food products, detergents, and other items.

Maryam has applied for a loan today in order to add more variety of food products to the store so she can one day separate her business from her house and expand it.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah, 43 years old, is a married woman. After her husband retired from his first job, he had to look for another one so he could support his family. So he started working as a general worker, which is hard on him because of his age.

To help her husband, Kefah started making detergent almost six years ago at home and selling it. She also started mixing some materials to make perfumes. Now Kefah has applied for a loan to buy more materials so she can mix more detergents and perfumes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more materials so she can mix more detergents and perfumes

loans.name: Jaime De Jesus

texts.es:
Jaime se ha caracterizado por trabajar fuertemente en su cultivo, con el que quiere sacar adelante a su hijo y a su esposa. 
Con 30 años de edad, Jaime se dedica desde muy temprana edad al cultivo, actividad que aprendió gracias a que su padre le enseñó desde pequeño. 
Jaime sueña con que su cultivo se crezca y coseche productos diferentes, de modo que pueda generar nuevos ingresos para su familia.
Jaime, debido a la temporada invernal, ha visto como sus cultivos no se han desarrollado como deben, por lo que requiere de la compra de abonos y riegos que le permitan cambiar esta situación.
Jaime con el ánimo de comprar estos productos, y debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de abonos y riegos que le permitan contrarrestar la situación de que sus productos se vean retrazados en su producción.

Jaime sueña con que un día pueda tener su propio terreno y no tenga que compartir el terreno de su padre, de este modo el generará mayores ingresos y también le permitirá a su padre tener un espacio mayor. 
Jaime sueña con que su hijo de 4 años pueda acceder a una educación de calida y en un futuro tenga la oportunidad de acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Jaime has described himself as a person who works hard on his land with the goal of moving his son and wife forward. At the age of 30, Jaime has dedicated himself from a very young age to farming, work he learned thanks to his father who taught him when he was quite small.

Jaime dreams that his harvest will grow and yield a variety of crops so that he can earn additional income for his family. Due to the winter season he has seen how his crops are not developing like they should so that he needs to buy fertilizer and irrigation that will enable him to change this situation.

Due to the fact that he lacks sufficient capital to buy the products he needs, he hopes that a loan will provide him the means of purchasing the fertilizer and irrigation that will enable him to counteract this set back to his crops’ development. 

Jaime dreams of some day having his own land and of not having to share land with his father. In this way he will earn greater profits and also enable his father to have more space. He also dreams that his 4-year-old son will be able to have a quality education and will have the opportunity to get a university education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad, 31 years old, is a housewife with two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a farmer.

Using some of her husband's experience, Nehad bought a few sheep and goats and started a trading business buying and selling animals. It has been three years now since she started.

Now Nehad has applied for a loan to buy more goats to increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 34 years old, is a married man with two daughters and one son..

Omar has been working with his brother for 10 years in their shop repairing cars. They repair tires and sell car oil. Now Omar has applied for a loan in order to buy more car oil to cover the shop’s and the customer’s needs.

loans.use: to buy more car oil

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Муж работает шофером. Более 15 лет она занимается откармливанием скота. Она очень хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия и чтобы достичь этого, ей нужно расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший доход.  С этой целью Ибодат запрашивает займ в размере 7000 Сомони для покупки крупного рогатого скота. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Ibodat is a hard-working and conscientious woman. She is married and is a loving mother of three children. Her husband works as a driver. For over 15 years Ibodat has been fattening cattle for sale. She would like to improve her living conditions, and needs to expand her business and earn good revenue in order to do that. To this end, Ibodat is asking for a loan of 7000 somoni to purchase cattle. She is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: Rufino.una muy buena persona tiene 51 años de edad vive en su casa pripia.desde muy pequeño empeso con su venta porque le gusto la venta,se inicio vendiendo ropa usada en un mercado y con la ganacia que genero esa venta pudo terminar de construir su casa y comprar mas ropa, pero esta ves ya nos ropa usada si no nueva,actual mente tiene dos locales de ropa nueva,el esta muy agradecido con la fundacion ya que por los creditos que le han otorgado el a podido crecer economicamente y tener mas mercaderia,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas ropa nueva por mayor y tener nuevos diseños en blusas trajes para niño y niña.
texts.en: Rufino, a very good person, is 51 years old.  He lives in his own house.  As a very small child he began with his sales because he liked selling.  He began selling used clothing in a market.  With the earnings that those sales generated, he was able to finish building his house and buy more clothing, but this time not used clothing, but rather new.  He currently has two stores of new clothing.  He is very grateful to the foundation, because through the credits that it has granted to him, he has been able to grow economically and have more merchandise.  He is asking for this loan to buy more new, wholesale clothing and to have new designs in shirts and suits for boys and girls.

loans.use: buy wholesale clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nasoom

texts.en:
Nasoom, 51 years old, is a hardworking mother of eight sons and daughters. Two of the daughters are married. Her husband is a private driver.

Nasoom works on farms, but that is not enough to support the family. So she started to sell blankets and clothes at home in addition to working on the farms. 

Now Nasoom has applied for a loan to buy more clothes so she can improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Abuk

texts.en: Abuk is 29 year old and married with two children. Both of the children are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years. Abuk is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell

loans.name: Abuk

texts.en:
Abuk is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Abuk is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Raad has been an owner of a workshop for wrapping and repairing motors and pumps for agriculture use since 1982. He has more than 20 years experience in this field and a good reputation. His workshop is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2100 loan in order to purchase agricultural machinery. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural machinery.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is 26 year old and married with no children. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years. Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is 38 years old and married with no children. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for four years. Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children.

Since 2009, Tarek has been the owner of a bakery selling bread and pastries. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order renovate his bakery and to buy an electric generator. His goal is to make more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery and buy an electric generator.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling at a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Nyiel is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fee of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Saqer

texts.en:
Saqer is a 33-year-old young man. He is a father with two sons and two daughters. Saqer is employed, but gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's costs. Saqer is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new bedroom  furniture for his children as his family members need to feel more comfortable at home. This loan will create better living conditions for the family. Saqer is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase new bedroom furniture for his children

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is 46 years old, married with two children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living and has been in the business for 5 years. He earns extra income from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, tea leaves, and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea leaves, and maize flour

loans.name: Azim

texts.ru: Азимджон трудолюбивый и умный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец двоих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 6 лет он занимается изготовлением и ремонтом ювелирных изделий. Бизнес является семейным. Азимджон изготавливает ювелирные изделия, а мать Маърифат продает. В данное время Азимджон имеет двух учеников. Каждый ученик платит ему по 1500$ США за весь период обучения(от 6 до 12 месяцев). Азимджон хотел бы получить займ для покупки сырья(лома) для изготовления изделий из золота.
texts.en: Azim is a hardworking and smart man. He is married and is a responsible father of two children. His wife is a homemaker. He has been making and repairing jewelry for more than six years. It's a family business. Azimjon makes jewelry and his mother Marifat sells it. At this time Azimjon has two students. Each student pays him $1,500 USD for the whole period of studying (from six to twelve months). Azimjon wants to receive a loan to buy raw materials (scrap) to make gold jewelry.

loans.use: to buy of raw materials (scrap).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products and dining supplies.

loans.name: Nyanlei

texts.en:
Nyanlei is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has been running a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan, for three years.

Nyanlei is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Flor Imelda

texts.es: Doña Imelda es casada y tiene un hijo es dueña de una tienda de ropa, y dueña de un taxi rotativo del pueblo todos las mañanas se dedica a bordar blusas típicas que vende en su negocio, y por las tardes se dedica a atender su negocio, su esposo se encarga de  atender el taxi que tiene, los dos negocios han sido muy rentables ya que cuentan que han prosperado, doña Imelda cuenta que quiere surtir su venta de ropa típica incluyendo cortes fajas y sandalias, ella necesita un crédito para poder realizar su deseo, ella promete ser cumplida en cada pago así como lo hizo anteriormente.esta muy agradecida con Fape y kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en: Imelda is married and has a son. She owns a clothing store and also has a taxi service. Every morning she embroiders traditional blouses to sell, and in the afternoon she tends to her store. Her husband is in charge of the taxi. The two businesses have been very lucrative and they have thrived. Imelda wants to stock up on traditional clothing, including sashes and sandals. She needs the loan to realize her dream, and she promises to make her payments as she has done in the past. She feels very grateful to Kiva and partner FAPE for the help they are providing.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Estrella De Belen Group

texts.es:
Doña María es casada, tiene 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 3 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la confección de pantalones, tiene 11 años de experiencia, inició gracias al apoyo de su esposo y un pequeño capital que disponía, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamos que le servirá para la comprar telas tipo lona, para poder producir mas pantalones, ya que quiere ver su negocio de confección amplio y con mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: confección prendas de vestir y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en: María, 27, is married and has three children, one of whom is studying. She never had the opportunity to go to school. She makes pants. She has 11 years of experience. She started thanks to support from her husband and a small amount of capital she had. Her husband, who is in the same occupation, supports her efforts. She organized a group in order to ask for a loan to buy canvas to make more pants because she wants to see her business expand and have better profits. The other group members carry out a variety of activities like making clothes and raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for sewing.

loans.name: Nonvignon 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON 3 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laure est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Laure est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Hlouédé. Laure vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Laure mène comme activité depuis six ans la vente de farine, de sucre et des amuses gueules dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Laure s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laure sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON 3, un quatrième crédit. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The NONVIGNON 3 group is made up of three persons of who live in the same neighborhood.  The facilitator of the group, named Laure, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 35 years old and married to a man named Hlouédé.  She lives with her husband and their two children, who both go to school and whom they both financially support.  Laure and her husband take care of the various household expenses together.  To this end, Laure has been involved in the sale of flour, sugar and appetizers in her neighborhood, for six years.  This activity allows her contribute to her family's needs, without any major difficulty.  Laure buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers, and to increase her turnover and revenues, Laure is requesting a fourth loan, together with the other members of the NONVIGNON 3 group.  The three previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy sacks of flour, appetizers, and sugar.

loans.name: Duo Geremias Group

texts.es:
Dúo Jeremías:
Doña Elsa y Brenda son integrantes del dúo Jeremías ambas son muy trabajadoras y muy buenas vendedoras,  son madres de familia doña Elsa es dueña de un puesto de verduras que se encuentra en la terminal de la zona 4, en donde todos los días vende con amabilidad a sus clientes, les vende todo tipo de verduras (tomate, ejote, papa, remolachas, chile pimiento etc.) todas las mañanas se traslada a la ciudad capital desde las tres de la mañana, ya que la venta de verduras es únicamente por las mañanas y son las únicas horas que se aprovecha para vender por mayor, ellas es feliz vendiendo verduras.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de verduras, Doña Brenda desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a vender aguacates por mayor, al igual que Elsa también vende en la terminal de la zona 4 Brenda cuenta que todos los días vende aproximadamente 1000 aguacates ella cuenta que le ha ido muy bien y puede ver sus ganancias constantemente su deseo es multiplicar sus ventas, ambas viven en la misma comunidad, y necesitan un crédito para invertir en sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias además prometen cumplir con sus pagos mensuales si se les llegara a autorizar un crédito que será de beneficio para sus familias y así mismo para la preparación personal y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Elsa and Doña Brenda together make up the "Jeremías Duo" borrowing team. They are both very hard working mothers, and very good sales-women. Doña Elsa runs a vegetable stall, located in Zone 4 of the city. Every day she sells all kinds of vegetables (tomatoes, squashes, potatoes, beets, chillies, etc), with always a friendly manner towards her customers, and every morning she goes to the capital city at 3am to buy her produce, because the vegetable wholesalers do business in the very early mornings. She is happy selling vegetables, and is seeking the loan to buy more.

For some years now, Doña Brenda has been selling avocadoes in bulk. She sells them in the same market in Zone 4 where Elsa works. Every day, Brenda sells approximately 1000 avocadoes, She says that business has been going well and she can see her earnings increasing. She wants to multiply her sales.

Both women live in the same community, and need the loan to invest in their businesses and increase their earnings. They promise to complete their monthly repayments on time if the loan is authorized. The loan will be of benefit to their families and help ensure the education of their children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Jaime De Jesus

texts.es:
Jaime se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la agricultura, actividad que le ha generado los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus hijos y su esposa.
Jaime aprendió la actividad gracias a que su padre se la enseñó desde muy pequeño, y con sus hermanos ha venido trabajando desde entonces.
Jaime, quién actualmente tiene su propio cultivo, ha visto como las condiciones climáticas le ha deteriorado sus cultivos, por lo que debe realizar pronto un riego con abonos y semillas, que eviten que su cultivo se deteriore por completo.
Jaime entonces, requiere de la compra de abono, semillas y riegos que le permitan mantener su cultivo sano, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para llevar a cabo la compra de estos productos, por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le permitirá comprar los abonos, riegos y semillas con los cuales podrá mantener en buenas condiciones su cultivo.

Jaime sueña con que su esposa y sus 2 hijos tengan una buena estabilidad económica, por esto ahorra y busca generar nuevas fuentes de ingresos.
Además, sueña con brindarles un futuro estable, una mejor calidad de vida, y una oportunidad de progresar y prepararse para obtener un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Jaime has dedicated much of his life to agriculture, which has generated the necessary income to sustain his children and his wife. He learned his work thanks to his father having taught him since he was very young, and along with his brothers he has been working ever since.

Jaime, who now has his own crops, has seen how the climate is causing his crops to fail, and for that reason he must install an irrigation system quickly, along with fertilizer for the seeds, to ensure that the crop does not fail completely. Jaime therefore wants to buy fertilizer, irrigators and seeds, which will allow him to keep his crop healthy - but he does not have the capital to take on the investment. For this reason he has pinned his hopes on a loan, which will enable him to buy the fertilizer, irrigators and seeds. with these, he will be able to keep his crop in good condition.

Jaime dreams that his wife and two children might have a stable future financially, so he is saving and seeking to generate new sources of income. He also dreams that he might offer his children a stable future, a better standard of living, and the opportunity to progress and one day have well-paid jobs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, irrigation and seeds for his crops.

loans.name: Jesus Vivi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUS VIVI est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jacqueline est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Jacqueline a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Jacqueline est mariée à un certain Nicaise. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jacqueline exerce depuis trois ans, la vente des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Jacqueline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son revenu, Jacqueline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUS VIVI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The JESUS VIVI group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood.  This is the second time that the group is applying for financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to boost its level of activity.  Jacqueline, the facilitator of the group, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 27 years old and lives in Benin.  She left school at the secondary level.  Jacqueline is married to a man named Nicaise.  Together, they have two children who both attend school and whom they financially support.   Jacqueline lives with her husband and children.  Husband and wife take care of the various household expenses together.  In order to contribute to these expenses, Jacqueline has been involved in the sale of second-hand clothes at a market in Benin, for three years.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers, and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the JESUS VIVI group.  The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es: Felipe, de 59 años de edad, originario de Estelí esta muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido por medio del préstamo Kiva que le permitió comprar insumos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra  que necesitaba en ese momento para sus cosechas de maíz y frijol. Logro vender una buena parte de su producción de frijoles y le demandaron mas maíz, es por ello que solicita este  crédito para sembrar 1 manzana de maíz y compra de una vaca para vender leche y poder obtener otros ingresos que le permitan mejorar su finca y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Felipe, who is 59, comes from Estelí. He is very grateful for the help he has received through Kiva, and the loan which enabled him to buy fertilizers adn other consumables, and to pay for labour that was needed to harvest his crops of maize and beans. He was able to sell a good part of his bean crop, and his customers demand more maize. Therefore he is seeking this loan to sow 1 manzana (i.e. 1.73 acres) of maize, and to buy a cow so that he will have milk to sell as another source of income. This income will enable Felipe to improve his farm and to give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To sow 1 manzana (1.7 acres) of maize and to buy a cow to sell milk.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 24 years old and married.

Haydar has owned a shop for electronic games since 2004. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3000 loan, in order to pay the annual rent on his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop.

loans.name: Rassoul

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has four children.

Rassoul has been the owner of a farm of calves since 1993, where he sells all kinds of dairy products. He gained good experience from his parents, has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy Friesian cows. He aspires to buy more cows to increase milk production and be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy Friesian cows.

loans.name: Adhieo

texts.en:
Adhieo is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of them are in school. 

She has had a fish selling business in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Adhieo is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.
