loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 years old and he is the father of one child. 

He sells clothes for a living and has been in the business for three years. He earns extra income from farming. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters and blouses to sell.

loans.use: To buy sweaters and blouses to sell

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old and married.

Amjad has been the owner of a shoe store since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to renovate his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his store.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old. 

She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and employs three people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow drying machine.

loans.use: To buy a blow drying machine

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Saleem is a 62-year-old man. He is married and has four sons and two daughters, all of whom are married.

Saleem is employed with a low salary. It is not enough to cover expenses to make necessary repairs to his house such as painting, changing the windows and doors and changing tiles. So he is requesting a $2,000 loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of repairing and improving the house's condition. This loan will give Saleem and his family better living conditions.

Saleem is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son Mahmoud appears in his Kiva profile photo.

loans.use: to make necessary repairs to his house.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and lives with three family members, one of whom works.

Abbass has been the owner of a shop selling mobile phones and accessories since 2006. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He also has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area, so there is a lot of passing custom.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan, in order to make a sliding door and an advertising box light. He is aiming to gain more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a sliding door and an advertising box light.

loans.name: Zouheir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has three children, one of whom works.

Zouheir has been the owner of a store selling toys for kids and stationery since 2006. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He also has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area, so there is a lot of passing custom. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan, in order to renovate his store and to make an outdoor ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate his store and to make an outdoor ceiling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for his shop

loans.name: Segnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sandrine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sandrine est âgée de 35 ans et vit au Bénin. Sandrine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Sandrine est mariée à un certain Euloge. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sandrine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de subvenir aux charges de la maison, Sandrine mène comme activité depuis trois ans, la vente de chaussures de façon ambulante. Sandrine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sandrine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEGNON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The SEGNON group comprises three people who live in the same area. This is the second time the group is seeking the financial assistance of ALIDé, in order to grow their business. The group representative is called Sandrine, she has her hand raised in the photo. Sandrine is 35 and lives in Benin. She stopped school after primary level. Sandrine is married to a man named Euloge. They have two children, both in school and living at home. Sandrine lives together with her husband and their children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Sandrine is a mobile shoe trader, an activity she has been doing for three years, in order to meet the expenses of the household. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, and to grow her turnover and profit, Sandrine is seeking together with the other members of the SEGNON group, a second loan with ALIDé. The first has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Sobeya Bloc2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sobéyé   est créé depuis 2008 à  l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Tabara,  (debout à l’extrême  droite), est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 05 enfants. C’est une couturière, elle achète des tissus (laine, lin et « thioub » c'est-à-dire des tissus teintés) qu’Elle coud en vu de les revendre. Elle jouit d’une très bonne expérience.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des tissus pour confectionner les différents articles qu’elle vend.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de garantir la scolarisation et la nourriture de ses enfants.
texts.en: The Sobéyé group was created in 2008 at the inauguration of the banc villageois. It comprises 14 women who live in the same area. Their main activity is small-scale trade. Tabara, (standing on the far right), is the group leader. She is 46 years old. She is divorced and the mother of 5 children. She is a seamstress, and she buys cloths (wool, hemp and "thioub", or dyed cloths)  which she sews in order to resell. She benefits from her significant experience. With this loan, she plans to purchase materials to produce the various articles she sells. The profits from this activity will allow her to ensure the children are fed and schooled.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to make the various articles she sells.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es: Lucinda, de 46 años de edad, originaria  de Condega municipio de Esteli expresa su agradecimiento por la ayuda recibida atravez del préstamo Kiva, el cual utilizo para compra de insumos, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra de la siembra de maíz y frijol la cual dio muy buenos resultados produciendo beneficios para su negocio. Por tanto ella quiere volver a comprar insumos y pago de mano de obra para  sembrar maíz y frijol motivo  por el cual solicita este segundo crédito. Ya que quiere almacenar y vender sus cosechas cuando se presente la escases de estos productos y de esta manera abastecer a sus clientes para que no carezcan de este producto. Espera seguir mejorando en su negocio, hacerle mejoras a su vivienda darle un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos.
texts.en: Lucinda, 46, who is from the municipality of Estelí in Condega, expresses her gratitude for the help received through the Kiva loan which she used to buy supplies and fertilizers, and to hire workers to plant the corn and beans that produced a good profit for the business.  Now, she is requesting a second loan to buy supplies and hire workers to plant corn and beans.  She wants to store what she harvests and sell her produce when crops become scarce to make sure her customers do not go without these items.  She hopes to continue improving her business, renovating her house and provide good maintenance for her crops.

loans.use: To plant corn and beans and buy supplies.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier, de 41 años de edad, originario de Palo Verde comarca de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor ,nos cuenta que después de su primera experiencia vivida por medio del préstamo Kiva le ayuda mucho a  conseguir parte de los insumos que necesitaba para sembrar tomates parte de las ganancias las volvió a invertir en la siembra de hortalizas la temporada propicio para el nuevo ciclo de siembra de tomates esta cerca es por tal motivo que solicita este crédito para compra de insumos, pago de mano de obra para sembrar 1/2 manzana de tomates. Espera que su producción sea mucho mejor que la anterior incluso cancelar el crédito con anticipación y poder comprar tierra para sembrar mas hortalizas.
texts.en: Javier, 41, is from the municipality of Estelí, in the Palo Verde County of Pueblo Nuevo.  He is a farmer who tells us that after his first experience with a Kiva loan, which he used to buy the supplies he needed to plant tomatoes, he invested in planting vegetables.  The best time to plant the new cycle of tomatoes is near and he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and hire workers to plant 1/2 manzana (a plot of land under a hectare) of tomatoes.  He hopes production will be better than before so he can pay off the loan ahead of time and buy more land to grow more crops.

loans.use: To buy supplies, hire workers and plant tomatoes.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel, originario de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, de oficio agricultor quien se dedica a la siembra de café y crianza de Ganado nos habla del buen uso y beneficio que le permitió el préstamo Kiva por el cual se siente agradecido por el enorme apoyo sembró 2.5 manzanas de café las cuales tuvieron buenos rendimiento y la calidad del café fue excelente. Ahora el quiere volver a sembrar 4 manzanas de café por cual solicita el préstamo para compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra en este nuevo ciclo de siembra. Espera seguir sacando una buena producción que le permita salir adelante con su familia y negocio, brindar empleos a la gente de las zonas cercanas.
texts.en: Manuel is from the municipality of Estelí in Pueblo Nuevo.  He is a farmer and grows coffee and raises cattle.  He tells us how he made good use of the Kiva loan for which is grateful and which gave him enormous support in planting the two and a half manzanas (a plot of land smaller than a hectare) of coffee.  The harvest was abundant and the quality of the coffee was excellent.  Now he wants to plant four manzanas of coffee and is requesting a loan to buy supplies and hire workers for the new planting cycle.  He hopes to produce a good crop that will help his family and business get ahead, so he can provide employment to people in nearby areas.

loans.use: To buy supplies and hire workers to plant coffee.

loans.name: Luz Marina Antonia

texts.es:
Luz Marina desde pequeña se ha sentido atraída por la actividad de la confección, es por esto que desde muy temprana edad se empezó a capacitar en cursos de confección y aprendió la actividad rápidamente.
Luz Marina, con 56 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales dice son la motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días. Al ver que con los ingresos de su esposo, no era suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos del hogar a cabalidad, Luz Marina decidió montar su taller de confección, y su esposo le regaló una máquina fileteadora y una máquina plana. Actualmente Luz Marina sigue desempeñándose en la misma actividad de la confección, y sus productos son muy reconocidos por ser de muy buena calidad.
Con el ánimo de empezar a sacar su propia línea de prendas de vestir, Luz Marina quiere comprar insumos para confeccionarla como es las telas y los hilos, sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta compra, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de telas e hilos para iniciar la confección de su propia línea de ropa.

Luz Marina sueña con sacar su propia línea de ropa muy pronto para poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. Además sueña con que sus hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, y no tengan que pasar por tantas adversidades en la vida como las han pasado ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Luz Marina has always been attracted to sewing since whe was little girl.  She began taking sewing courses and trained to be a seamstress quickly when she was very young.

Luz Marina is 56, married and the mother of two children.  She says they are her motivation for working so hard every day.  When she realized her husband's income was not enough to cover household expenses she decided to set up a sewing workshop.  Her husband bought her an overlock sewing machine and a long-arm sewing machine.  Currently Luz Marina is still active in this business and her products are very well known for their excellent quality.

In order to begin making her own line of clothing, Luz Marina wants to buy supplies such as fabrics and thread.  But she does not have enough capital for the purchase and is hoping to receive a loan to buy the materials she needs to begin sewing her own line of products.

Her dream is to have her own clothing line soon and generate employment for people in need of work.  She also wants her children to have a better lifestyle and not suffer the hardships she and her husband have gone through.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as fabrics and thread to make her own line of clothing.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia es una persona que siempre ha querido salir adelante y sacar a su familia adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Maria Eugenia es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de su único hijo de 9 años, pues el padre del hijo la abandonó hace un tiempo.
Maria Eugenia es conocida por tener dotes de emprendedora y sentido social, y gracias a esto montó una panadería y ha ofrecido empleo a las personas más necesitadas.
Maria Eugenia aprendió la actividad de la panadería gracias a que anteriormente trabajó en 2 panaderías donde aprendió de sus jefes la actividad perfectamente. Ahora, Maria Eugenia tiene su panadería que es conocida en su sector por tener productos de mucha calidad y por ofrecer un muy buen servicio.
Maria Eugenia cuenta con una vitrina para exhibir sus panes que ya se encuentra en su máxima capacidad, por lo que no tiene donde exhibir sus nuevos productos. Con el ánimo de sacar productos de repostería, Maria Eugenia quiere comprar una vitrina para poderlos exhibir a sus clientes, sin embargo, no cuenta actualmente con el dinero suficiente para esta compra, por lo que tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una vitrina en la cual pueda exhibir sus nuevos productos.
Maria Eugenia espera que de esta manera sus ventas se incrementen considerablemente, y de esta manera tenga más ingresos con los cuales le pueda ofrecer a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.

Maria Eugenia sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, y en un futuro pueda tener la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria y tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia is someone who has always wanted to get ahead and provide for her family through much effort and dedication.  She is a single mother and head of household with a 9-year-old son.  Her husband left her some time ago.  She is known for being an entrepreneur and having a social conscience, which is why she set up a bakery and has offered jobs to many people in need of work.

She learned the trade from her bosses in the two bakeries where she worked in previously.  Now, Maria Eugenia has a bakery that is well-known in the industry for its high quality products and good customer service.

Maria Eugenia has a display case for her breads which is at full capacity.  So she does not have space to disply new products.  In order to start selling pastry Maria Eugenia wants to buy a display case to exhibit them to customers.  But she does not have enough money right now for the purchase and is hoping a loan will allow her to buy a case to display her new products.

She trusts this will help her increase sales considerably so she can easrn more income to give her son a better quality of life.

Maria Eugenia wants her child to receive a good education so he can get a university degree and achieve economic stability.

loans.use: To buy a display case for her bakery products.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She sells potatoes and tomatoes to earn a living, and has been doing so for two years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mulekye

texts.en:
Mulekye is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells oranges to earn a living. She has been in the business for 20 years and employed one person. She earns extra income from farming. 

Since Mulekye joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy oranges to sell.

loans.use: to buy oranges to sell.

loans.name: Leddy Ruth

texts.es:
Leddy ha sido una persona muy reconocida por tener una gran capacidad para superar las adversidades que le ha presentado la vida, y seguir adelante con sus propósitos. Leddy, con 40 años de edad, se encuentra casada y espera sacar adelante su hogar y brindarles a su esposo y a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida.
Leddy, actualmente se dedica a la confección, actividad que aprendió debido a que trabajó como operaria de confección en diferentes empresas. Un día tomó la decisión de montar su propio taller, ya que su empleo era muy mal pagado, y actualmente continúa trabajando en su propio taller de confección.
Leddy, se dedica principalmente a la confección a terceros, y generalmente tiene muy buenos pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Sin embargo, en la actual temporada sus pedidos disminuyen ya que sus clientes también disminuyen sus ventas. Es por eso que Leddy quiere aprovechar para empezar a sacar su línea propia de prendas de vestir, por lo que va a compra materias primas como telas e hilos. Sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el dinero para ello, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de comprar telas e hilos para comenzar con la confección de su propia línea de prendas de vestir.

Leddy sueña con que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, y poder así tener mayores posibilidades de brindarles a sus padres y su esposo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leddy is very well known for her ability to overcome the setbacks that life has presented her with and for striving to achieve her goals. Leddy is 40 years old, she is married and she hopes to get her family ahead and provide her husband and her parents with a better quality of life.

Leddy currently works in the dressmaking industry, a job she learned from working as a dressmaker in different companies. One day she decided to start up her own dressmaking workshop since her  job was very badly paid. She is still working in her own workshop.

Leddy mainly does dressmaking for third parties and her customers generally make very good orders. However, her orders are currently decreasing as her customers are decreasing their sales. Therefore Leddy wants to take this opportunity to bring out her own line of clothing, for which she will need supplies such as material and thread. However she cannot afford this at the moment and is therefore hoping that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to buy material and thread to produce her own clothing line.

Leddy hopes that her income will increase considerably and that she will subsequently have a greater chance of providing her parents and her husband with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material and thread to start her own clothing line.

loans.name: Nzembi

texts.en:
Nzembi is 49 years old and married with three children. She farms vegetables to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and employed 4 people. 

Since Nzembi joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Jouk

texts.en: Jouk is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is 23 years old and he owns rental houses to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy iron sheets for building new rental houses.

loans.use: To buy iron for building new rental houses.

loans.name: Amour

texts.en: Amour is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for two years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a vegetable selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of purchasing vegetables during the dry season. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell vegetables in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 31 years old and she is married with four children. She runs a beauty salon and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow dry machine.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow dry machine.

loans.name: Nyanjuk

texts.en: Nyanjuk is a 40-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in Langer Bor, South Sudan, for one year. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ruwa

texts.en:
Ruwa is 31 and single and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a meat goat selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of poor storage facilities leading to losses. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase goats for his meat selling business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for his meat selling business.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo, 32, is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a soap manufacturing business. In addition, she also operates a cafe business which provides another source of income. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase soap manufacturing materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase soap manufacturing materials.

loans.name: Tiir

texts.en: Tiir is 34-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for three years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo. Él es una persona luchadora y trabajadora con valores y principios. 

Darwin se dedica a la compra, venta de ganado y al destazo de estos para posteriormente vender la carne. Este negocio lo aprendió desde que era niño ya que sus padres realizan estas actividades desde hace muchos años y él se ha dado cuenta que es un negocio prospero y productivo.

Los productos que necesita los compra en los cantones más cercanos al lugar donde vive, también viaja en autobús por muchos kilómetros, el ganado se lo llegan a dejar a su casa, cuando destaza el ganado tiene que trasladar la carne en su espalda por un kilómetro y medio ya que el transporte en su zona es muy escaso. El compra y vende animales ya sean cerdos o vacas para revender una vez a la semana y destaza dos veces a la semana y la carne la vende en un puesto de venta.

Darwin solicita el préstamo para comprar más cantidad de animales, para poder ampliar aún más el negocio y tener mejores ingresos. Así él contara con un mejor margen de ganancia y podrá comprar más animales para la venta.

Él desea construir una casa propia con esos ingresos, ya que él, su esposa y su bebe viven en la casa de sus padres. También quiere comprar un vehiculo para transportar su mercadería desde su casa hasta donde lo comercializa y así obtener mejores ingresos para brindarle a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Darwin is 25 years old. He lives with his life's companion and his son. He is a fighter and a hard worker with values and principles. 

Darwin buys and sells cattle and butchers animals to later sell the meat. He learned this business as a child because his parents have done these activities for many years and he realized that it is a prosperous and productive business. 

He buys the products he needs in the nearby cantons and also travels many kilometers in bus. The cattle are brought to his house. When he butchers the cattle, he  has to transport the meat on his back for a kilometer and a half since transportation in his area is very scarce. He buys and sells animals whether they be pigs or cows, re-selling them once a week and butchering twice a week. He sells the meat at a sales spot.

Darwin is asking for the loan to buy a larger quantity of animals to be able to expand his business even more and have better income. This way, he will have a better profit margin and be able to buy more animals to sell. 

He wants to buy his own house with this income, since he, his wife and his baby live in his parents' house. He also wants to buy a vehicle to transport his merchandise from his house to where he sells it and thus obtain better income to offer his family what they need.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals to re-sell and to butcher.

loans.name: Adau

texts.en: Adau is a 39-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in Langber Bor, South Sudan, for three years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase onions and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, traveling from home to the market where villagers are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing fuel. He dreams of expanding and purchasing another motorcycle in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, he wants to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and maize for planting.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor manera de reconocer a Jorge Ivan, una persona que gracias a su carisma y ganas de salir adelante, ha progresado como un nuevo empresario en la actividad que tanto le ha gustado.
Jorge Ivan, con 43 años de edad, casado y padre de 2 hijos, trabajó durante más de 12 años en un gimnasio de la ciudad, donde laboraba como la persona encargada del montaje y el mantenimiento de los equipos. Jorge Ivan no le gustó seguir adelante con ese empleo debido a que era muy mal pago.
Jorge Ivan decidió tomar al camino de independizarse, y montó su propio taller de máquinas para gimnasio, donde fabrica las máquinas y también le hace mantenimiento a las máquinas de varios gimnasios de la ciudad. Gracias a esto, Jorge Iván genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Jorge Iván actualmente tiene un contrato para entregar unas máquinas de gimnasio con un muy buen cliente suyo, y requiere de más materia prima para culminar la elaboración de este y otras máquinas más. Sin embargo, no cuenta con suficiente dinero puesto que su cliente le paga una vez entregada la máquina, es por esto que Jorge Ivan tiene la esperanza puesta en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas como hierro, metal, entre otros, para la elaboración de las máquinas para el gimnasio.
Jorge Ivan sueña con que su negocio crezca y se consolide como un referente en la región, de modo que pueda generar empleo para las demás personas que más lo necesitan y también genere suficientes ingresos para progresar con su familia.
Jorge Ivan sueña brindándole a su esposa una mejor calidad de vida, y a sus 2 hijos el acceso a una educación de calidad. Jorge Ivan sueña con que su familia en un futuro tenga una estabilidad económica que les permita evitar pasar por situaciones adversas como las que ha tenido que pasar el en la vida.
texts.en:
Enterprising is the best way to describe Jorge Ivan, someone who, thanks to his charisma and desire to get ahead, has progressed as a businessman, doing the job that he likes the most.

Jorge Ivan is 43 years old, he is married and is a father to 2 children. He worked in a city gymnasium for more than 12 years, as the person responsible for setting up and maintaining the equipment. Jorge Ivan did not want to continue doing this job due to the poor pay. He decided to go down the road of independence and he set up his own workshop for gymnasium equipment, where he manufactures and performs maintenance for several gymnasiums in the city. This provides Jorge Ivan with the necessary income to maintain his household.

Jorge Ivan currently has a contract to deliver some gymnasium machines to a very good customer of his and he needs more raw material to complete the production of this and other machines. However, he does have enough money due to the fact that his customer will pay him once the machine is delivered. Therefore Jorge Ivan is hoping that a loan will provide him with the possibility to purchase raw materials such as iron and metal among other items, for the production of the machines for the gym.

Jorga Ivan is hoping that his business will grow and become a point of reference in the region so that he will be able to generate employment for people who need it most and also to generate sufficient income for the progression of his family. Jorge Ivan dreams of providing his wife with a better quality of life and providing his 2 children with access to quality education. He dreams that his family will have economic security in the future, allowing them to overcome adverse situations, like those which he has surpassed in life.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the production of gymnasium equipment.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a married man with eight children, four of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business. He faces a major challenge of theft due to lack of security in his area of operation. He dreams of expanding and purchasing a motor vehicle for his public transport business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his broken motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
Jose Noe siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Con 66 años de edad, casado y padre de 7 hijos, trabaja todos los días fuertemente con el ánimo de sacar su familia adelante y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Jose Noe se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 16 años a la actividad del reciclaje, actividad que ejerce en su carro donde transporta todo lo que recoge y posteriormente vende.
Jose Noe ha encontrado en esta actividad su fuente de ingresos, y gracias a esto ha podido cubrirle las necesidades a su familia.
Jose Noe encuentra una gran ventaja en trabajar con su carro, pues en este puede transportar una gran cantidad de reciclaje, lo que hace que en menos recorridos tenga mayor eficiencia que las personas que lo hacen a pié o en carretillas.
Jose Noe tiene su carro desde hace muchos años, y ahora esta presentando inconvenientes debido a fallas mecánicas en su vehículo, además debe comprar el seguro del vehículo, pues la vigencia del anterior ya caducó. Es por esto que Jose Noe requiere de un capital que en la actualidad no posee, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra del seguro del vehículo y a realizarle el mantenimiento que requiere el motor del vehículo. 

Jose Noe sueña con que su negocio le genere ingresos que le permita comprar un nuevo vehículo más grande, y poder así transportar mayor reciclaje. Además, tiene el gran sueño de que su familia pueda salir adelante, sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de mayor calidad y progresen económicamente.
texts.en:
Jose Noe has always been characterized as a hardworking person who is dedicated to his family. At 66 years old, he is married and the father of 7 children. He works hard every day, wanting to get his family ahead and offer them a better quality of life.   

Jose Noe has worked in recycling for about 16 years. He does this work with his car, with which he transports everything he picks up and later sells.
Jose Noe has found his source of income in this activity, and thanks to it he has been able to cover his family's needs. 

Jose Noe finds a great advantage to working with his car, because with it he can transport a large quantity of recycling in fewer runs, with more efficiency than the people who do it on foot or in carts.  

Jose Noe has had his car for many years and now it is causing him problems due to mechanical failure. He also has to buy car insurance, because the previous insurance expired. That is why Jose Noe needs capital that he doesn't have right now. He hopes that a loan will afford him the opportunity to be able to buy the vehicle insurance and do the maintenance that his vehicle needs.    

Jose Noe dreams of his business generating enough income for him to buy a newer, bigger vehicle and thus be able to transport more recycling. He also has the big dream of his family being able to get ahead and his children accessing a higher quality education and progress financially.

loans.use: to buy insurance and do maintenance on his vehicle, which he uses to transport recycling.

loans.name: 17  Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Nhuần has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. Nhuần has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase votive objects to resell.

Nhuần is 33-years-old and she is married with 2 children. Nhuần is the group leader of the 06.01.17-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Nhuần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhuần has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Nhuần faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhuần hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects to resell.

loans.name: 0103012-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Hoan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hoan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Hoan is 48-years-old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 0103012-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

In 2011, Hoan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Hoan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hoan hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: 0103011-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

Lan is 38-years-old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 0103011-Bắc Sơn-Hoằng Phụ-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lan has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children and five of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She is a poultry farmer and works from her home on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks. Her major challenges are the increasing prices of chicken feed, poultry diseases and seasonality. 

Her aspirations and goals are to own 20000 laying birds and also to buy a van to ease the transportation of chicken feed. She lives in her own house and the family has access electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells second-hand shoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand shoes. Her major business challenges are the rainy season because she works from an open place and thieves. 

Her aspirations and  goals are  to start importing used shoes and also to start selling wholesale. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales  of used shoes.

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta Cecilia es una persona que de pequeña no recibió educación, por lo que cuando creció se le hizo muy difícil conseguir un empleo. 
Marta Cecilia gracias a un curso que le dieron, aprendió la actividad de la confección, y posteriormente gracias a un muy buen jefe que tuvo, ingresó a un trabajo como operaria de confección en una empresa.
Actualmente, Marta Cecilia, con 64 años de edad se encuentra casada y es madre de 2 hijos, a los cuales siempre les quiso brindar todo lo necesario.
Marta Cecilia tuvo la oferta de su jefe de tener una máquina en su casa que le permitiera trabajar desde allí, por lo que actualmente Marta Cecilia recibe telas cortadas y ella confecciona las prendas de vestir. 
Marta Cecilia tiene mucha producción atrasada, debido a que no tiene una máquina de coser aparte de la suya; por esto quiere comprar una máquina de coser plana, para generar un empleo y tener una persona que le ayude con las actividades del trabajo. Sin embargo, Marta Cecilia no cuenta con el dinero suficiente en estos momentos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina de coser que le permita tener una persona como empleada trabajando al lado suyo.

Marta Cecilia espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente debido a que podrá recibir más trabajo por parte de la empresa, y así podrá ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Además, quiere ofrecerle el empleo a una persona que tenga grandes necesidades y requiera urgentemente de unos ingresos.
texts.en:
Marta Cecilia did not receive an education when she was little.  Therefore, when she grew up it was hard for her to find a job.  Thanks to a course that she was given, she learned how to make clothes.  Later, thanks to a very good boss that she had, she worked as a sewing machine operator in a business.  

Marta Cecilia, age 64, is currently married and has two children.  She has always wanted to give them everything that they need.

Marta Cecilia’s boss offered her the chance to have a machine in her house.  This would allow her to work from home.  Therefore, Marta Cecilia now receives cut fabrics, and she sews them into garments.  Marta Cecilia is very behind in her production because she only has her one sewing machine.

That is why she wants to buy a sewing machine to generate a job and to have a person to help her with her work.  However, Marta Cecilia does not have enough money at this time.  This is why Marta hopes for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy a sewing machine that will allow her to have an employee working at her side.

Marta Cecilia hopes that her sales increase considerably because she will be able to get more work from the company.  This way she will be able to give her husband and her two children a better quality of life.  Also, she wants to offer a job to a person who is in great need and urgently needs some income.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, which would allow her to hire a person to help her with her sewing.

loans.name: Maria Mery De Jesus

texts.es:
Maria Mery es una persona que ha sufrido muchas adversidades en la vida, sin embargo, a pesar de esto ha salido adelante con mucho amor por su trabajo y su familia. Con 63 años de edad, Maria Mery es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos, debido a que su esposo murió hace poco. A sus hijos siempre les ha querido brindar todo lo que necesitan. Maria Mery ha sacado su familia adelante, y ahora sus hijos poco a poco le han ido colaborando con los gastos del hogar, pues uno de ellos ya consiguió un trabajo temporal.
Maria Mery, con el ánimo de generar un poco más de ingresos para su hogar, quiere iniciar la venta de mercancía por catálogo, gracias a que conoce a muchas personas que serían muy buenos clientes. Sin embargo, Maria Mery no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar la compra de las mercancías que ofrecerá en un principio a sus clientes, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de uso personal para ofrecerle a sus clientes y conseguir buenas ventas.
Maria Mery espera poder superar la muerte de su esposo, puesto que hasta el momento le ha dado muy fuerte esta situación. Además, sueña con sacar su familia adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Mery has suffered a lot of adversities in her life.  In spite of this, she has gotten ahead with a lot of love for her work and her family.  Maria Mery, age 63, is a single mother and the head of her family of two children.  This is because her husband died a short while ago.

She has always wanted to give her children what they need.  Maria Mery has gotten her family ahead.  Now her children have been, little by little, contributing to the household expenses.  One of them got a temporary job.

Maria Mery, looking to generate a little more income for her household, wants to start selling merchandise by catalog.  She knows a lot of people who will be very good customers.  However, Maria Mery does not have enough money to purchase the merchandise that she will offer her customers in the beginning.

This is why she hopes that a loan will give her the opportunity to buy personal use merchandise to offer her customers and to get good sales.

Maria Mery hopes to be able to overcome the death of her husband given that, so far, the situation has been very difficult for her.  Also, she dreams of getting her family ahead and improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy personal use merchandise to offer her customers and to get good sales.

loans.name: Norman

texts.es:
Norman, es habitante de La Esperanza una comarca localizada en las afueras de Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, es casado tiene 3 hijos. El es agricultor de 37 años de edad que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar en las labores del campo. Aprendió a cultivar hortalizas, preparar la tierra y a criar animales en estos últimos años se ha dedicado a la especialización de crianza de cerdos de raza ya que son muy solicitados en su zona. La otra parte de su tiempo esta trabajando en siembra de hortalizas y granos básicos, siempre buscando la manera de cómo sobrevivir y darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia donde su primordial función es garantizarles una buena educación a sus hijos. 
El realizo el crédito para comprar cerdos de raza para criar. Ya que e gustaría especializarse mas en la producción de este tipo de animales para darles un mejor cuido y tenerlos en mejores condiciones y venderlos a un buen precio. El desea usar parte de las ganancias para ir mejorando su casa poco a poco y darles una vivienda digna a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norman lives in La Esperanza, a región on the outskirts of Yalaguina in the Estelí municipality.  He is married and has three children.  He is a 37 year old farmer who has devoted himself to farm work since he was very young.

He learned how to grow vegetables, prepare the land, and to raise animals.  In these past years he has devoted himself to the specialty of raising purebred pigs because they are in much demand in his area.  The other part of his time he works at growing vegetables and basic grains.  He is always looking for the way to survive and to give his family a better standard of living.  His key role is to ensure his children get a good education.

He took the loan to buy purebred pigs to raise.  He would like to become more specialized in the production of this type of animal.  This way he will give them better care, he will keep them in better conditions, and he will sell them for a good price.

He wishes to use part of his income to improve his house little by little.  He wishes to give his children a decent home.

loans.use: to buy purebred pigs to raise.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam, 54, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of selling foods for over ten years and is successful in her career. She earns approximately 16 USD per day. Two of her children are construction workers.

In order to improve her business, Sam is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to raise capital for her business in order to purchase more food ingredients to produce all kinds of food for her clients.

In the future, she would like to expand her business, rebuild her present house and support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients in order to produce all kinds of food for her clients

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, 48, is married and resides with her husband and four school-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dry fish for over ten years and is successful in her career. She earns approximately 40 USD per day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns approximately 5 USD per day.

In order to improve her family's economy, Mon is asking for a loan of 500 USD to purchase more dry fish to sell. By doing so, she would generate extra income to support the family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business, rebuild her present house to be much stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family. Moreover, she plans to support her children to study until they get a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish to sell

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Sarath, 27, is single and resides with his mother and two siblings in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is employed at a garment factory and earns approximately 3 USD per day. His mother runs a grocery store at home and earns approximately 7 USD per day.

Sarath is requesting a loan of 200 USD to purchase dirt to fill up the land around his house. In the future, he would like to expand his mother’s business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill up the land around his house

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling traditional cakes for over four years, earning approximately 2.5 USD per day. Her two children are employed: one is employed at a garment factory and another one is a motor taxi driver.

Phan is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to pay for her son’s wedding ceremony. In the future, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much stronger and to provide a comfortable living condition for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat, 28, is married and resides with her parents, her husband and one child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a garment factory for years, earning approximately 6 USD per day.

In order to get comfortable living conditions, Sophat is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase furniture to decorate her house to be more attractive. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate income for the family. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to live separately from her parents.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to decorate her house to be more attractive

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
María, es agricultora vive en una comunidad llamada Isiqui en las afueras de Estelí, tiene 3 hijos. Lleva 20 años dedicándose a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Ella forma parte de una cooperativa de 5 socios con los que siembra granos básicos y  también se dedican a la crianza de ganado. Cuando la época de siembra de hortalizas es Baja ella se dedica a trabajar como jornalera en las siembras de tabaco junto con su esposo pues ambos se apoyan para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella realizo el crédito para la compra de 3 vacas para vender leche. Uno de sus proyectos es hacer un pozo en el terreno para tener agua cerca y abastecer a los animales.
texts.en:
María, a farmer, lives in the Isiqui community outside of Estelí.  She has three children.  She has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.

She is part of a cooperative of five members who grow basic grains and also raise livestock.  During the season when there is little to do with her crops, she works as a day laborer in the tobacco fields with her husband.  Both of them support each other in order to get the family ahead.

She got the loan to buy three cows in order to sell milk.  One of her projects is to make a well in the ground in order to have water nearby and to provide for the animals.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to sell milk.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Originario de Condega municipio de Estelí, de 45 años de edad, es el señor Gerardo quien es agricultor desde hace mas de 30 años. El empezó ayudar a sus padres a trabajar en el campo desde los 15 años de edad aprendió y adquirió bastante experiencia acerca de las labores del campo. El tiene dos hijos los cuales esta estudiando su esposa lo ayuda con las labores del campo y también con las tareas del hogar.
El solicita el crédito para compra de una vaca, la cual quiere utilizar para reproducir ganado para vender leche y cuajada y de esta manera mejorar los ingresos para su familia y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerardo is from Condega in the Estelí municipality.  He is 45 years old, and he has been a farmer for over 30 years.  He started helping his parents work in the field when he was 15 years old.  He learned, and he acquired plenty of experiences with field work.

He has two children who attend school.  His wife helps him with the fieldwork and also with taking care of the house.

He is requesting the loan to buy a cow.  He wants to use it to reproduce livestock and to sell milk and curds.  This is the way he will improve income for his family and make his business grow.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Diocelina

texts.es:
Diocelina es una persona que es caracterizada por su carisma y sus ganas de brindarles una oportunidad de vivir mejor a las demás personas. Diocelina se encuentra casada y es madre de 3 hijos, y a ellos les quiere brindar siempre la mejor calidad de vida posible. Es por esto que decidió iniciar a trabajar de cuenta propia, puesto que los ingresos que genera su esposo son muy bajos para poder vivir de manera adecuada. 

Diocelina se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal como ropa, accesorios, lociones, entre otros, a través de catálogos y tiene en el negocio más de 2 años de experiencia que le han servido para conseguir muy buena clientela y muy buenas ventas. Diocelina actualmente tiene grandes pedidos de sus clientes que no ha podido satisfacer por la falta del capital suficiente para realizar las compras a su proveedor, es por esto que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía de productos de uso personal como son ropa, accesorios, lociones, cremas de manos, entre otros, y poder así atender los pedidos de los clientes. 

Diocelina sueña con que su negocio le genere muy buenas ventas y pueda así brindarles a sus 3 hijos y su esposo unas mejores condiciones de vida, donde sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad y su esposo y ella no tengan que sufrir tantas dificultades económicas.
texts.en:
Diocelina is a person characterized by her charisma and her desire to provide to others the opportunity for living better. Diocelina is married and the mother of three children, to whom she wishes always to provide the best possible quality of life. Thus she decided to go into business for herself, since the income generated by her husband is very low for the purposes of living in an appropriate manner. 

Diocelina earns a living selling personal use products such as clothing, accessories, and lotions among other items, through catalogs. She has over two years of experience in the business which has allowed her to develop a very good customer base, and her sales are very good. Diocelina currently has some large orders from her customers which she has not been able to fulfill for lack of sufficient capital to make the purchases from her supplier. Thus she is hoping that a loan will allow her the opportunity to carry out the purchase of merchandise of personal use products such as clothing, accessories, lotions, and hand creams among other items, and thus be able to service her customers' orders. 

Diocelina dreams that her business would generate very good sales so she would able to give her three children and husband a better lifestyle, in which her children may have access to a quality education, and she and her husband would not have to suffer so many financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy personal product merchandise such as clothing, accessories, lotions, and hand cream among other items.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la confección, puesto que desde muy joven su madre le enseñó la actividad. Siempre le ha gustado y es por esto que después inició un curso donde le enseñaron más acerca de las técnicas de confección. Una vez aprendió todas las técnicas y aprendió a producir prendas de vestir, su padre le regaló una máquina para iniciar su trabajo, y estas máquinas las ha ido renovando con el pasar del tiempo. 

Actualmente Luz Elena sigue con su propio taller de confección y ya compró dos máquinas más, además de una mesa de corte y otras herramientas más para su taller. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que confecciona, Luz Elena tiene muy buena reputación entre sus clientes, los cuales le hacen muy buenos pedidos. A menudo, Luz Elena tiene que contratar a 2 personas para que le ayuden con su trabajo, pues los pedidos son tan grandes que no le da para confeccionarlos ella sola. 

Luz Elena ha visto como sus ventas se han incrementado significativamente, y ya no la manera de confeccionarlos a máquina y a mano no le esta dando resultados. Es por esto que Luz Elena acude a la esperanza de que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina de confección industrial, con la cual pueda realizar su confección de manera automatizada y produzca de manera más eficiente. 

Luz Elena sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y le genere buenas ganancias con las cuales pueda brindarles a su esposo y a sus 2 hijos de 14 y 18 años, una mejor calidad de vida y una prosperidad económica y estable.
texts.en:
Luz Elena has dedicated the greater part of her life to sewing since her mother taught her this business from a very early age. She has always enjoyed it and so later she decided to begin a course of study where she was taught more about the techniques of dressmaking. Once she learned all the techniques and learned to make articles of clothing, her father gifted her a sewing machine with which to begin her work, and she has been refurbishing these machines as time goes by. 

Currently Luz Elena remains in business with her own dressmaking shop and has already purchased two additional machines, as well as a cutting table and other tools for her shop. Thanks to the good quality of the apparel she makes, Luz Elena has a very good reputation among her customers, who place very good orders with her. Frequently Luz Elena must hire two persons to help her with her work, since the orders are so large that she is not able to fulfill them all on her own. 

Luz Elena has seen her sales increase substantially, and making the clothes by machine and by hand is no longer producing results.  Thus Luz Elena turns to the hope that a loan may provide her with the possibility of being able to purchase an industrial sewing machine with which to construct the apparel in automated, and thus more efficient, fashion. 

Luz Elena dreams that her business would continue to grow and generate a good profit with which to offer her husband and two children, of 14 and 18 years of age, a better quality of life and stable financial prosperity.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Seng Hart

texts.en: Seng Hart, forty-two, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over ten years and is successful in her career. All of her children are employed in different work. They are a teacher, a pizza company staff member and a garment worker. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Seng Hart is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her present house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang, fifty-six, is married, resides with her husband and two university-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling rice and bran in the market for over twenty years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a soldier. In order to support her children to study in higher, education, Leang is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a computer and pay university fees for her children. By doing so, her children would be able to finish their Bachelors degrees. In the future, she would like to purchase more rice and bran to sell to generate more income for the family, and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and pay university fees for her children.

loans.name: Vicheka

texts.en: Vicheka, twenty-six, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are garment workers and earn approximately USD 7 per day. Vicheka is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase construction materials to build her house. By doing so, her family will have better living conditions. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate more income for the family and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a farming business, selling farm produce of beans and peas from door to door to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nyamvula dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds for farming. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for farming.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Habiba operates a car wash business from home where motor vehicle operators are her potential customers. In addition she also operates a meat-goat selling business from which she earns her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of water shortage for her car wash business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more goats for resale and a water tank for water storage for the car wash business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale and a water tank for water storage for a car wash business.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
Juan Felipe es una persona muy dedicada a su familia, a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar todo lo que necesitan.
Juan Felipe, con 23 años de edad, ya ha conformado una familia con su pareja y un hijo de 1 año de edad, quien siempre es la motivación para trabajar arduamente durante todos los días. Juan Felipe siempre ha querido que su familia no tenga que pasar por dificultades económicas, y es por esto que siempre que tiene la oportunidad genera nuevas fuentes de ingresos diferentes a su actividad principal.
Juan Felipe se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 3 años a la venta de frutas en la plaza mayorista de su municipio, y gracias a este trabajo genera los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Juan Felipe ha tenido muy buena clientela gracias a sus productos de buena calidad y al buen servicio que ofrece, sin embargo, su negocio ha visto como se ha deteriorado con el paso de los años. Juan Felipe entonces quiere realizarle algunas mejoras a su negocio, además de surtir su negocio con más productos, pero no tiene el capital suficiente para ello. Es por esto que Juan Felipe aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de frutas como papaya principalmente, y a realizarle mejoras locativas a su sitio de venta.

Juan Felipe tiene el sueño de que su negocio le pueda dar buenos ingresos, y le permita brindarles a su hijo y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida.
Además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad, y tenga la oportunidad de en un futuro ingresar a una educación universitaria que le permita acceder a un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Juan Felipe is very dedicated to his family. He has always loved providing them with their every need.
At the age of 23, Juan Felipe already has a family: he and his wife have a one-year-old baby. They are always his motivation for working hard every day. Juan Felipe has always wanted to shield his family from economic hardship. For this reason, whenever he has the chance he generates new sources of income on top of his main job.
Juan Felipe has sold fruit for approximately three years in the wholesale market of his municipality. Thanks to this work, he makes enough money to support his family.
Juan Felipe has a very good customer base thanks to the good quality of his products and his excellent customer service. However, his business has deteriorated with the passing of time. Therefore, Juan Felipe wants to make some improvements to his business as well as to stock his business with more products; but he does not have the necessary capital for this project. For this reason, Juan Felipe hopes to get a loan which will allow him to buy fruit such as papaya, mainly, and to make some improvements to his stand.
Juan Felipe dreams of his business providing him with a good income, and allowing him to offer his wife and child a better quality of life. He dreams of his child being able to access a good, quality education, and to have the opportunity to attend university and find a well-paid job.

loans.use: to buy stock; fruit, mainly papaya, and to make some improvements to his stand.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Blanca tiene 30 años de edad, esta acompaña con dos hijos.

Hace 6 años que se dedica al comercio, es propietaria de una tienda, ella aprendió esté negocio con su suegra, quien también tiene una pequeña tienda. Antes de instalar su propia tienda Blanca no tenia ninguna fuente de ingresos y debido a la necesidad de brindarle alimentación a sus hijos, empezó a vender productos de la canasta básica y fue viendo que los resultados eran positivos fue creciendo su negocio y sus ingresos. Ella adquiere todo lo que necesita para la tienda en el mercado de la ciudad, por lo que debe caminar a pie hasta la carretera para abordar el autobús, los otros productos se los van a dejar los camiones repartidores a su casa.  

Blanca solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar dos quintales de frijoles, cinco quintales de maíz, tres cajas de jabón, detergentes, aceite comestible, bebidas, útiles escolares y el resto del dinero los invertirá en productos varios. De esta manera ella surtirá su tienda y se asegurara de tener de todo un poco, para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y evitar que ellos compren en otro lugar. 

Al mantener más surtida su tienda, venderá más y así sus ingresos serán mayores para cancelar su préstamo, asegurar la alimentación de su familia y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos para que estudien una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca is 30 and has two children.
She has been a merchant for six years and owns her own store. She learned this business from her mother-in-law, who also has a small store. Before opening her store, Blanca did not have a source of income; due to the need to provide for her children, she started to sell basic goods. The results were good, and her business and income have grown. She buys everything that she needs for the store in the city market; in order to do so, she has to walk to the highway to catch the bus. Other products are delivered to her home.
Blanca is requesting this loan from Fundacion Campo for the purchase of two quintals of beans, five quintals of corn, three boxes of soap, detergent, oil, drinks, school supplies, and other varied merchandise. This way, she will stock her store and make sure that she has a bit of everything in order to satisfy customer demand and ensure that her customers don't go elsewhere to make their purchases.
By maintaining her store well-stocked, she will sell more and increase her income so that she can pay off her loan. She will be able to ensure that she can support her family and provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy two quintals of beans, five quintals of corn, three boxes of soap, detergent, oil, drinks, school supplies, and other varied products.

loans.name: Sinoeurn

texts.en: Sinoeurn, thirty-six, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been growing vegetables and flowers to sell for over ten years and is successful in her career. She earns approximately USD 2.7 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day. Her two children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a automobile mechanic. Due to the lack of funds for building her house, Sinoeurn is asking for a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase construction materials to construct the house. In the future, she would like to expand her business by growing more vegetables to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build her house.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is twenty-four years old. He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and employs one person. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno, 36, is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals business, selling millet, sorghum, maize and beans from door to door and also from home. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation while moving from door to door. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of millet, sorghum, beans and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of millet, sorghum, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is 37 years old. She is a mother of one child. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for seven years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to own a wholesale in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man with three children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 12 years, he has operated a carpentery business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. In addition he also operates a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transportation business. He faces a major challenge of lack of customers to buy his products. He dreams of expanding the business and establishing a workshop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase timber for use in the carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for use in the carpentry business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 22 years old, married with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living, and she has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. She does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy blouses and sweaters to sell.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. She does farming to earn extra income. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers and skirts for resale.

loans.use: To buy trousers and skirts for resale

loans.name: Kuany

texts.en:
Kuany is 32 years old and a married woman with four children; two of them are in school. She has had a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Kuany is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi 49, is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of purchasing vegetables. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell her vegetables in. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Nyantet

texts.en:
Nyantet is a 28-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food items in Bor, South Sudan for two years. 

Nyantet is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for resale.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Ruby has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ruby has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ruby hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim, 31 years old, is married and has two children, ages three and seven years. He describes himself as a go-getter and an ambitious man. He has been selling cereals for the last three years to local residents. In addition, he also sells herbal medicine. His business challenge is inadequate funds to improve the retail cereal shop. He will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more cereals such as maize, beans, etc. Salim's hope and dream in the future is to have diversified his business and venture into a grocery store to increase his income.

loans.use: to  buy more cereals such as maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 14 children. 

Mila has a shop that sells bananas, sweet potatoes & cassava per kilogram. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy bananas, sweet potatoes & cassava to sell.

Mila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, sweet potatos & cassava to sell.

loans.name: Fatou Ndiaye

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou Ndiaye, âgée de 44 ans est commerçante depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille.
Avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite elle voudrait aller à Rosso en Mauritanie pour  acheter des produits cosmétiques, des chaussures et des tissus pour venir le revendre dans le pays.
Madame Fatou Ndiaye aide son époux dans la gérance des dépenses  du foyer  en payant la scolarité des  enfants.
Elle aimerait avoir une bonne assise et agrandir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Fatou Ndiaye is 44 years old and has been a shopkeeper for over 10 years. She is married and a mother. She would like to use the money from the loan she is requesting to go to Rosso, in Mauritania, in order to buy beauty products, shoes and fabrics to resell back in her country.

Fatou Ndiaye supports her husband with the household expenditures by paying for the children´s education. She would like to establish a good foundation and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Lidio Edvín

texts.es:
