Naranjargal is 32 years old and lives with her husband and her daughter in a common apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She runs a clothes tailoring shop close to her home. Initially, she started her business alone 2 years ago. Currently, 3 sewers work in her tailoring shop with 5 old sewing machines. 

In a month there will be the Lunar Year, which is a Mongolian traditional respectful celebration, and traditional cloth orders (called “deel”) will be increased notably during those days. Therefore, Naranjargal wants to prepare her raw materials early for the celebration. It is a big chance to take so many orders. 

The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing the tailoring raw materials of traditional clothes such as deel for increasing the number of orders.

loans.use: To purchase the tailoring raw materials of traditional clothes, such as deel, to increase the number of orders.

loans.name: Farangis

texts.ru: Фарангис умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей.  Более пяти лет она занимается купле- продажей риса. Она приобретает товар из разных кишлаков и продает на рынке за выгодную цену. Фарангис хотела бы получить займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки риса с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Farangis is an intelligent and hardworking woman. She is married and is a loving mother of two children. She has been engaged in rice resale business for over five years.  She purchases rice in various villages and then resells it at the market for a profitable price. Farangis would like a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy rice and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
51-year-old Marites is a married woman with 4 children between the ages of 13 and 26. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Marites sells fish for a living. She buys fresh fish from fishermen and sells them at the market. She also helps her husband sell his catch. Aside from fishing, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells items like soft drinks and canned goods. She earns about 19,500 php per month with her businesses.

She has requested this loan to buy fishing nets as well as more fish and other items to sell, such as canned goods. Marites plans to use her profit to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and more fish and items to sell such as canned goods.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 54-year-old married woman with 3 children aged 19, 17 and 17. She is engaged in farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Aside from farming, she also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like shampoo, soap, canned goods and noodles. She works hard to earn more and sustain her family, especially her children's education.

Julieta has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and also more items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar and coffee. She hopes for her farm and store to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and also more items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона более 3 лет занимается купле продажей лепешек. Она замужем и любящая мать одного ребенка. Она торгует на центральном рынке города. Она каждый день покупает от 500 до 700 шт. лепешек по доступной ей цене и перепродает за выгодную цену. Этим она зарабатывает на жизнь. Фарзона хотела бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса с целью увлечения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Farzona has been engaged in reselling of flat cakes for over 3 years. She is a married and is a loving mother of one child. Farzona sells flat cakes at the city central market. She purchases from 500 up to 700 flat cakes daily at a reasonable price and resells them for a profitable price. By doing this, Farzona earns her living. She would like to get a loan to expand her business and increase her working capital.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 38 years old and lives in Nakuru. She is married to Joseph and they have two children, aged 19 years and 8 years.

Dorcas has a food restaurant that she runs and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy baking flour, sugar, charcoal, etc. to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a big hotel in the near future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal, sugar, baking flour, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vicente, a vendor, and the mother of seven children. One is already employed, three have already finished their studies, and the rest are still studying. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gemma operates a meat processing business. She has a factory a few steps from her house where they manufacture processed meat products. Gemma earns by selling her goods to her neighbors and to suppliers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 466 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 18,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional processed and frozen meat products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gemma hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for meat products and other ingredients needed in her meat processing business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 29 years old. She is married with three school-going children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of about KES 15,000 from the business.

This is her second term loan in KADET LTD .She paid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plant.

She hopes to purchase a piece of land to expand her farming and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Naima

texts.ru: Наима трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она заботливая жена и любящая мать троих детей. Муж работает шофером. Более 4 лет Наима занимается купле- продажей лепёшек. Она имеет свою торговую точу на центральном рынке города. Наима имеет много клиентов. Наима хотела бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки муки с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Naima is a hardworking and kind woman.  She is a caring wife and a loving mother of three children.  Her husband works as a driver.  Naima has been engaged in flat cakes resale for over 4 years.  She has her own market stand at the central market of the city.  Naima has many customers.  She would like to get a loan in the amount of 4,000 Somoni to buy flour in order to expand her business.  She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Spider Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her mid 20s, is married and has one child. She has been selling cosmetics for five months now.  She works from 9:00am to 7:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she wants to use it for increasing her stock of cosmetics.  Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Spider" which has a total of 17 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans

loans.use: to increase on her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora, que gracias a su dedicación y empeño, ha sacado su propio negocio adelante.
Con 2 hijos de 7 y 14 años de edad, Juan Carlos tiene un hogar donde siempre ha sido un ejemplo a seguir, gracias a que su esposa y el les brindan el mejor ejemplo a sus dos hijos.
Juan Carlos se dedica a la distribución de productos de panadería y dulcería, actividad que aprendió gracias a que trabajó durante un tiempo en una comercializadora que realizaba esta labor. Un día Juan Carlos vio que su empleo era muy mal remunerado y decidió independizarse y montar su propia comercializadora. Inició repartiendo la mercancía en una moto, y con el apoyo de algunos préstamos pudo comprarse un carro y atender a más clientes, ya que podía transportar más cantidad.

Actualmente, Juan Carlos tiene su negocio con muy buenos clientes, y gracias a esto, sus ingresos han ido aumentando considerablemente. Juan Carlos, a menudo, tiene tantos clientes que no alcanza a satisfacerlos a todos, pues la mercancía que tiene es muy poca para tantos clientes que le compran. Es por esto que Juan Carlos tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de panadería y confitería, para tener una mayor cantidad y poder comercializarlo a más clientes y continuar generando los ingresos para su hogar.

Juan Carlos sueña con que su negocio le pueda dar grandes ganancias, y posteriormente pueda montar una gran comercializadora para vender los productos a diferentes ciudades y poder generar empleo. Además, Juan Carlos sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad y que el y su esposa puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a very hard-working man who through dedication and commitment has ensured the progress of his business. As the father of two children, aged 7 and 14, Juan Carlos has a home where he has always been a good example. His wife and he are role models to their two children.

Juan Carlos distributes bakery products and sweets. He learned this activity when he worked in a store. When he realized one day that his job was very poorly paid, he decided to become independent and launch his own business. In the beginning he distributed the goods on a motorcycle, then a few loans helped him to buy a car and he could serve more customers because he could transport a larger quantity of goods.

Currently, Juan Carlos runs his business with a very good customer base and because of this his income has increased considerably. Often he has so many customers that he can't serve them all, because his inventory is not sufficient for all his customers. This is why Juan Carlos hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to buy more bakery goods and pastries in order to have more goods to sell to more customers and thus he would continue to earn money for his household expenses.

Juan Carlos dreams that his business may give him a good profit. Later on, he might launch a great selling company and offer his products in several cities and create jobs. In addition, Juan Carlos dreams that his children get a high-quality education and that he and his wife could enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more bakery goods and pastries in order to have more goods to sell to more customers.

loans.name: Henry Nelson

texts.es:
Henry es una persona emprendedora que desde hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió montar su propio negocio. De su padre aprendió la actividad de la agricultura, y ha venido desempeñando esta actividad por cuenta propia. Henry tiene en su cultivo cosechas de mora, cartuchos y tomate de árbol, los cuales vende para poder generar los ingresos con los que sostiene los gastos del hogar.

Henry ha visto como el invierno ha afectado la calidad de sus cosechas, por lo que requiere urgentemente de el riego de fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas que le permitan tener su cultivo de la mejor calidad posible. Sin embargo, Henry no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que espera a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas y fungicidas para regar en sus cultivos y garantizar la calidad de los mismos.

Henry tiene el sueño de que su cultivo crezca y tenga grandes ventas de este, de modo que pueda generar ingresos que le permitan brindarles a sus padres una buena calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Además, Henry quiere ahorrar para poder ingresar a una educación superior, pues hasta el momento sus bajos ingresos no se lo han permitido.
texts.en:
Henry is an entrepreneur who, approximately seven years ago, decided to start his own business.  He learned about agriculture from his father, and has been doing this activity on his own.  He has a blackberry crop, lilies, and tree tomatoes which he sells to generate income to support the household expenses.

He has seen how the winter has affected the quality of his crops,  which means they urgently require a spraying of fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides so that his crop will be of the best quality possible.  However, he does not have sufficient capital to buy these things, which is why he hopes that a loan will give him the chance to buy the fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides to spray on his crops and guarantee their quality.

He dreams that his crop will grow and he will have great sales from it, which will generate income that will allow him to give his parents a good quality of life and economic stability.  In addition, he wants to save to enter into higher education, because so far his low income has not allowed for this.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides to spray on his crops and guarantee their quality.

loans.name: Gulomiddin

texts.ru: Гуломиддин очень трудолюбивый и умный человек. Он женат и любящий отец четверых детей. Последние годы он занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он приобретает скот на рынке города, подкармливает их в течении 3-4 недель, затем продает за выгодную цену. Гуломиддин запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Gulomiddin is a very hardworking and intelligent person. He is married and is a loving father of four children. He has been engaged in cattle resale over the last few years. He purchases cattle at the city market, fattens animals for 3-4 weeks, and then sells them for a profitable price. Gulomiddin is requesting a loan to purchase cattle and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Emerita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Emérita trabajadora, humilde con su negocio ambulante de pan siendo su principal fuente de ingreso. Esta solicitando otro préstamo para la construcción del muro d enfrente y cambiar en otra parte de la casa el techo. El último préstamo le genero grandes beneficio ya que coloco cerámica en el suelo alejando a su familia de enfermedades  por lo que era de tierra. 
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, bloques, piedras canteras, estribu, arena, piedrín, hierro, laminas de zinc, entre otros materiales que requieren para cumplir con su plan del muro de la vivienda generándole protección para su familia.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo del desarrollo de sus proyectos alcanzando mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Emérita is hardworking and modest. Her bread selling business is her main source of income. She is requesting another loan to build a facade wall and to change the roof in another part of her house. Her last loan was of great benefit to her as she laid tiles on the floor reducing the possibility of illness for her family, as before they simply had a dirt floor.

With the new loan she will buy construction materials such as cement, blocks, quarry rocks, buttresses, sand, gravel, iron and zinc sheeting among other materials that she needs to carry out her plan for building a wall, which will provide protection for her family.

She is grateful to the financier for supporting the development of her projects, for the achievement of better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a front wall for her home.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 49, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gerardo and has two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosana operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan as part of her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosana hopes her business grows more in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for scrap materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 26 years old. She is a mother of one child, aged 6. She runs a retail shop to earn a living and has been in the business for five years. She also does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 KES to buy maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es:
Alexander es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser un emprendedor y tener siempre ideas nuevas. Desde muy temprana edad inició trabajando como conductor de una ruta de la ciudad, y gracias a esto generaba sus propios ingresos. Sin embargo, al crecer, casarse, y tener hijos, estos ingresos ya no serían suficientes para poder sostener todos los gastos de su hogar.
Alexander entonces decidió montar el servicio del lavado de buses en la terminal de buses de la ruta que maneja, y de esta manera alterna sus dos actividades generando mayores ingresos. Alexander, con 38 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años, los cuales son una motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días. En el lavado de buses, Alexander emplea a dos personas que necesitan de los ingresos, y gracias a esto puede mejorarles la calidad de vida a las demás personas. 

Actualmente Alexander tiene muy buenos clientes, sin embargo ha perdido algunos debido a que le falta una aspiradora con la cual pueda ofrecer el servicio completo del lavado de buses, es por esto que busca la compra de una aspiradora. Sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una aspiradora que le permita ofrecer el servicio de lavado de buses de manera completa. Así incrementará sus clientes.

Alexander aspira que con unas ventas superiores, logre cumplir su sueño de tener a sus hijos estudiando en una institución de calidad. Además, sueña con que sus hijos en un futuro puedan acceder a una educación universitaria, ya que el no lo pudo conseguir por la falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Alexander is a person characterized for being an entrepreneur and for always having new ideas.  Beginning at a young age he began working as a conductor for a route in the city, and thanks to this he generated his own income.  However, as he has grown, married, and had children, this income is no longer sufficient to be able to support all the household expenses.

Therefore, he decided to start a bus washing service at the bus terminal of the route he drives, and in this manner he alternates his two activities generating a better income.  He is 38 years old, is married and is a father to two children of 14 and 12 years of age, who are his motivation for working hard everyday.  In the bus washing business, he employs two people who need the income, and thanks to this he can better the quality of life of other people.

Currently he has some very good customers, however, he has lost some since he does not have a vacuum to offer a more complete bus washing service.  This is why he is wanting to buy a vacuum.  However, he does not have the capital necessary to buy this, that is why he hopes that a loan will give him the chance to buy a vacuum and offer a more complete bus washing service.  In this way, he will increase his customer base. 

He hopes that with superior sales, he will be able to fulfill his dream of sending his children to a quality school.  In addition, he dreams that in the future his children will be able to get a university education, since he was not able to get one because of lack of funds.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum.

loans.name: Lizy

texts.en:
Lizy is a twenty-six-year-old lady from Kisumu city and is married to businessman Kennedy. They have two children.

Lizy operates a clothes selling business at Jubilee market and has been doing this for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy new dresses, ladies skirts, and blouses. She will use her profits to educate her kids.

Her dream is to own a big boutique.

loans.use: To buy new dresses, ladies skirts, and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Janete

texts.en:
This is Janete, 43, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a tricycle driver, and they have three children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Janete is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and resells it by the container (5 gallons each) for a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more mineral water to expand her stock. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Janete dreams of being able to give her all her children a good future and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for mineral water products needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma Senovia

texts.es:
Alma Senovia tiene 36 años de edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos entre las edades de 15 a 3 años de los cuales solo la mayor estudia, y vive con su familia  en la Colonia Veracruz, San Pedro Sula. 
Alma se dedica al negocio de venta de tortillas. El cual lo estableció desde hace 1 años, ya que en su zona donde vive no había  muchos negocios que se dediquen a esta actividad. Y eso le ayudo a tener mas demandas en el negocio. Al cual le dedica todo el día.
Este negocio le genera algunas ganancias, las cuales a reinvertido en adicionar o vender otros productos como la venta de topogigios, hielo, choco bananos, golosinas y también la venta de comida los fines de semana ya que sus clientes le demandan también este tipo de producto por la afluencia de niños que llegan a comprar.
Ella solicita ahora un préstamo de 4,500 lempiras el cual invertirá en comprar más producto como churros, confites, y otros. Para poder tener variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, y  generando mas ingresos a su hogar.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder llegar a construir su propia casa y así poder darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alma Senovia, age 36, is married and has six children between the ages of 15 and 3.  Only the oldest goes to school.  She lives with her family in the Veracruz settlement, San Pedro Sula.

Alma sells tortillas.  She established her business one year ago.  There were not many businesses like this in the area where she lives.  This helped her to have more demand in her business, in which she works all day.  This business generates some income, which she reinvests in adding or selling other products like “ topogigios” (ice-cream in a plastic bag), ice, chocolate bananas, and candy.  She also sells food on the week-ends because of her customer demand.  She also sells this type of product because of the number of children who come to buy.

She is now requesting a loan for 4,500 lempiras to buy more products like churros, candy, and others.  She will do this in order to be able to have a variety of products to offer her customers and to generate more income for her household.

Her goal is to continue working in order to be able to build her own house.  This way she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more products like churros, candy, and others.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys, de 42 años es una mujer fuerte. Hace 8 años enviudó; teniendo desde entonces que afrontar el cuidado de sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Jauja. El semblante melancólico que muestra, es a causa de la muerte de una de sus hijas, que hace un mes falleció. Se siente triste, pero sabe que tiene que continuar trabajando, para sacar adelante a sus demás hijos, Su principal trabajo es el servicio de lavado de ropa a sus vecinas, que le pagan de acuerdo a la cantidad que lava, ahí obtiene algunos ingresos, pues no siempre realiza ese servicio. Por ello en las mañanas trabaja en una casa, donde limpia y cocina, ahí le pagan un sueldo mensual que le permite mantener la economía de su hogar. “Tengo muchos trabajos, pues soy la única que mantengo a mis hijas”, afirma. Ahora su proyecto es aprovechar el trabajo que le ofrece el gobierno de la ciudad en la construcción de una nueva carretera, según comenta sus hijos dejarán de recibir la pensión por orfandad que reciben y desea obtener un trabajo estable, por ello quiere acondicionar el triciclo que tiene para vender dulces en las calles, colegios y fiestas, donde hay buena demanda. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “sin fronteras” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Gladys de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en arreglar su triciclo para comenzar a vender los dulces.
texts.en:
Gladys is 42 years old and is a strong woman. 8 years ago, she became a widow and since then she has had to face rearing her 4 children. She looks after them in her parents' house which is located in the city of Jauja. Her melancholic expression is due to the death of one of her children who passed away one month ago. She feels sad but she knows that she must continue working in order to get her other children ahead in life. Her main job is to provide a laundry service for her neighbors, who pay her according to the amount she washes. She earns some money from this but she does not always carry out this service. Therefore, in the mornings she works in a house where she cleans and cooks. There they pay her a monthly salary which allows her to financially support her home. "I have many jobs since I support my children by myself", she states. 

Now her plan is take advantage of the job that the city government is offering for the construction of a new road. She says that her children will stop receiving the orphan's pension and she wants to get a stable job. She therefore wants to set up a work tricycle to sell candy on the streets, in schools and at festivals where there is good demand. 

She belongs to support group "Sin Fronteras" [Without Borders] and this is her third loan with MFP. Therefore she is hoping for a small loan to allow her to fulfill her objectives. Apart from that she promises to make her repayments, as she did in her previous loan. Furthermore she is pleased to belong to her association because all the members are responsible and supportive. On receiving the support, Gladys will invest the requested money in setting up her tricycle to begin selling candy.

loans.use: to set up her work tricycle from which she will sell candy.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia ha sido una persona que ha trabajado gran parte de su vida con el ánimo de primero sacar sus padres adelante, y ahora brindarles a su esposo y sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Anteriormente trabajaba en la tienda con su mamá y así aportaba para sostener los gastos que se generaban en su familia en ese tiempo. Actualmente sigue trabajando en la misma tienda, pero ya con el objetivo de contribuir a los ingresos de su hogar, debido a que con el salario de su esposo no alcanza para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar.
Claudia atiende gran cantidad de clientes, la mayor parte debido al buen servicio que ofrece, y gracias a esto pueda aportar un dinero suficiente para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Actualmente Claudia tiene un buen nivel de ventas, por lo que su inventario constantemente lo tiene que surtir. En el momento su tienda se encuentra con pocas cantidades de productos para ofrecer, pero no tiene el dinero suficiente para realizar la compra de estos productos a sus proveedores, es por esto que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar como arroz, aceite, azúcar, entre otros, para surtir su negocio.

Claudia espera que con la compra de estos productos su tienda pueda tener mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer, y de esta manera podrá atender todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Además, sueña que su esposo y sus 4 hijos puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y un progreso económico.
texts.en:
Claudia has been a person who has worked a great part of her life with the intention first of moving her parents ahead and now of providing a better quality of life for her husband and children. Formerly she used to work with her mother in the store and thus contributed toward meeting family expenses at that time. Currently, she continues working in the same store, but now with the objective of contributing to her own household expenses since her husband’s salary is not sufficient to cover all of those expenses.

Claudia waits on a large number of customers, in great part because of the good service she provides and, thanks to this she can contribute sufficient money to maintain her home.

Currently, Claudia has a good level of sales and constantly has to re-stock her inventory.  At the moment, her store has a small quantity of products on the shelves, but she does not have sufficient money to purchase these items from her suppliers. Consequently she hopes that a loan will enable her to buy basic household goods such as rice, cooking oil, and sugar among other items and stock her business.

Claudia hopes that with the purchase of these products her store will have a larger quantity of items to offer and in this way she will be able to meet her customers’ demands. As well, she dreams that her husband and 4 children will have a better quality of life and make economic progress.

loans.use: to buy basic household food items such as rice, cooking oil and sugar, among others, in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz, de 23 años es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Michael y Adeliz a los que cuida en casa de su tía, ubicada en el anexo de Yanamarca. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para atender a los pobladores de su anexo, quienes constantemente la visitan para comprar alimentos. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Paralelo a ello y gracias a la ayuda de sus hijos siembra papa, habas y quinua en terrenos alquilados, pues no cuenta con unos propios. Le va muy bien en su negocio y en cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos en el mercado de la ciudad. Pero como ella es una mujer responsable y aprovecha cada oportunidad para obtener ingresos, comenzó hace poco a criar vacas, cerdos y pavos; los cuales cuida con dedicación, para venderlos por kilos a los carniceros que la visitan constantemente. Ahora planea ahorrar dinero para comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Virgen María” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Beatriz de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en: Beatriz is 23 years old and a brave single mother. She lives with her two children, Michael and Adeliz. She cares for them in her aunt's house, located in a town next to Yanamarca. She gets up early every day to attend the to the residents of her town, who constantly visit her to buy food. She already has 3 years experience selling basic necessity products. At the same time, thanks to help from her children, she plants potatoes, beans and quinoa on rented land, as she doesn't have her own. It is going very well for her and after every harvest she sells her products at the city market. But since she is a responsible woman who takes advantage of every opportunity to make income, a short while ago she started to raise cows, pigs and turkeys. She takes very good care of them in order to sell them by the kilo to the butchers who constantly visit. Now she plans on saving money to buy her own crop land. She belongs to the "Virgen Maria" solidarity group and this is her fourth loan with MFP. She hopes for a small loan to meet her goals. She promises to make her payments on time as she did in the previous loan. She likes being a part of her association because all of he members are responsible and supportive. If Beatriz receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in  buying basic necessity products for her food store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth, 42, is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines where she is married to Gill, her business partner, and a mother to one child. With help from her husband, Lilibeth manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a food stall and also delivers breads for additional income, her regular customers consisting of her neighbors and the local community. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is both family tradition and a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered wasteful to spend money on cooking gas and food for one to two persons when cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Lilibeth earns a minimum of Php500 in sales everyday.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy more quantities of products such as meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lilibeth dreams of giving her child a good and high quality education through all of her hard work on her business and also hopes to have her own restaurant. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 31 years old, married with one child.  She owns hardware in the area of Mwiki where she supplies hardware items. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of KES 16,500 per month. 

Leah has got good credit history with KADET Ltd and she is applying for her second loan of 60,000 from KADET Ltd, which she plans to use to buy more hardware materials.

She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.  Leah hopes to start a big hardware store and become the main supplier of building material in Mwiki.  She is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy hardware material for supply.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 36 years old, married with four children.  She sells used shoes to earn a living and she has been in this business for ten years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  She has applied for 28,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 28 years old, married to Elizabeth and they are blessed with two children.

Stephen operates a retail shop in Tala market, Kenya.  He has been in this business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 6,000 per month.

Stephen is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd which he plans to use to buy stock for his business such as sugar, flour, cooking oil to sell.  He will use the anticipated profit to refinance his business.

Stephen hopes to have a wholesale business in the future.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy stock such as baking flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Duo Mujeres Bondadosas Group

texts.es:
MUJERES BONDADOSAS

Este dúo está formado por doña Toribia de 49 años de edad casada, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a la venta de ropa típica desde hace 15 años, nos cuenta que necesita el crédito porque se aproxima la época en la cual le piden blusas de uniformes y ella necesita tener porque ya tiene clientes que le compran, además ahora quiere comprar suéteres escolares y venderlos,nos cuenta que esta contenta porque sabe que si le ayudan con el credito podra realizar sus metas,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa tipica y sueteres escolares. también esta doña Oralia de los ángeles, de 21 años, casada tiene 1 hijos y es dueña de una pequeña tienda, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito porque necesita surtir su tienda además en esta época escolar ella compra útiles escolares para los niños para que la gente de su sector no tenga que salir al pueblo para buscar los útiles de sus niños sino que ella pueda venderles además la gente ya sabe y esperan que ella empiece a vender, las dos señora son trabajadoras y lo único que quieren es apoyar a sus esposos con los gastos de su casa y poder darles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Duo Mujeres Bondadoras Group ("the kindhearted women") is composed of two women.

The first member is Doña Toribia, aged 49, married and the mother of two children. She has been selling traditional clothes for the past 15 years. She told us that she needs this loan, because the season for uniform blouses is ahead and she has customers who will buy them. Currently, she wants to buy school sweater for resale. She is happy because she knows that if her loan is granted, she will be able to achieve her goals. She applies for this loan to buy traditional clothing and school sweaters.

The group has a second member: Doña Oralia de los Ángeles, aged 21, is married and the mother of a son. She owns a small store and applies for this loan to stock up her inventory. In addition, the school term has begun and she will buy school supplies for the children, so that people in her neighborhood don't need to travel to town to get the school supplies for their children, but buy them from her store. People know and expect that Oralia will soon start selling these supplies.

The two ladies are hard-working people and their only wish is to help their husbands with household expenses and offer a better living standard to their children.

loans.use: to buy typical clothes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Gloria Patricia

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada en su familia. Debido a que con el salario que se ganaba su esposo no era suficiente para poder sostener los gastos del hogar donde conviven con su hijo de 7 años, Gloria decidió empezar a trabajar con el ánimo de aportar ingresos para su hogar. Gloria tiene un kiosco al lado de su casa y lo tomó para montar una tienda general en la cual vende productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a esta actividad, Gloria pueda generar los ingresos suficientes con los cuales poder contribuir a mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposo y su hijo. 	

Actualmente Gloria ha tenido muy buenas ventas, por lo que su negocio se encuentra muy bajo en la cantidad de mercancía que ofrece, pues debido al inicio de la temporada escolar donde tiene grandes gastos para el ingreso a la educación de su hijo, no cuenta con el dinero para poder surtir su tienda. Es por esto que Gloria tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para poder surtir su negocio.

Gloria espera que de esta manera pueda seguir generando ingresos para su hogar y poder así seguir contribuyendo en su familia a mejorar su calidad de vida. Gloria tiene el sueño de que su tienda crezca y se convierta en un supermercado en el cual pueda generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is a person who has been characterized as being very hard-working and dedicated to her family. Since the salary that her husband earned was not sufficient to be able to support the bills of their home where they live with their 7 year old son, Gloria decided to start to work with the aim of  providing income for her home. Gloria has a kiosk on the side of her house and she took it to start a general store in which she sells basic products. Thanks to this activity, Gloria can generate enough income with which she can contribute to improving the quality of life of her husband and son.

Currently, Gloria has had very good sales a result of which her business finds itself very low in the quantity of merchandise it offers. Due to the beginning of the school season when she has large expenses for her son's education, she does not have the money to be able to stock her shop. Because of this, Gloria has hope that a loan will provide her the possibility of accessing the purchase of basic products  so she can stock her business.

Gloria hopes that in this way she can continue generating income for her home and be able to continue contributing in her family to the improvement of their quality of life. Gloria has the dream that her shop grows and becomes a supermarket in which she can generate income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic products in order to be able to stock her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 57 years old from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married with children.

Peter is a farmer and has applied for a loan from KADET Ltd, to enable him buy farm inputs, chemical sprays and labor expenses.  He is optimistic that his business will do well after receiving the loan.

He hopes to expand his business and make more profit, which will help him to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, chemical sprays and labor expenses.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 41 years old from Nakuru and is married with one daughter.

Moses has a retail business and has applied for a school fees loan to enable his daughter go to school.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a friend who is also a client here.

He hopes to see his daughter receive a good education and expand his business as well in the future.

loans.use: to pay his daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant and pay for the labor.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es: Blanca se acerca a nuestra institución solicitando su primer crédito viendo  la posibilidad  de  hacer  crecer  su  negocio,  ya  que  actualmente  tiene  un negocio  de   venta  de  tortillas  de   harina en esta  ocasión ella requiere  adquirir una maquina especial para hacer tortillas ya que comenta se han incrementado mucho las ventas ,  ve  en  el crédito   la  posibilidad  de  produccir  un mayor  numero de  tortillas ya  que   el  trabajo  será   mas  rápido,  agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para   la  realización de   su  proyecto.
texts.en: Blanca approached our institution requesting her first loan having seen the possibility to grow her business. She currently has a business in which she sells flour tortillas. On this occasion she needs to purchase a special machine for making tortillas as she states that her sales have greatly increased. The loan will afford her the possibility of producing a greater number of tortillas as she will able to work more quickly. She is grateful for the support that she has received in carrying out her plan.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making tortillas

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles polygames, les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la  commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de mortiers, calebasses simples et gravées. Dans le but de consolider leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’adhérer à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème prêt solidaire.
 Madame Awa, 2ème de la gauche vers la droite) fait la vente des mortiers et pilons bien gravés  avec de beaux slogans et figures surtout pendant les périodes de mariage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 75 mortiers simples qui seront gravés. 
Pour faire de la gravure, on met des aiguilles dans le feu pendant une heure au moins, quand elles rougissent, on l’enlève puis on fait de beaux dessins avec sur la partie externe des mortiers simples en fonction du goût de la clientèle. 
Elle se ravitaille en matières premières auprès des forgerons des villages et effectue ses ventes au comptant et à crédit à domicile, dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et à l’approvisionnement de la famille en céréales.
texts.en:
All married within polygamous families, the four women of the Benkadi Group are on average 42 years old and have six children.  They all live in the rural village of Sakoïba in the region of Ségou and know each other through kinship and marriage. The group members sell small goods like mortars, simple gourds which have been carved.  In order to strengthen their businesses, the group members decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their 12th group loan.

Madam Awa, second from the left, sells mortars and pestles engraved with beautiful sayings and images, particularly during marriage seasons.  She intends to use this loan to purchase 75 plain gourds which will be carved.  To do the engraving, she puts needles in the fire for at least one hour.  When they turn red, she removes them from the fire then makes her beautiful drawings, according to the tastes of her customers, on the outside of the gourd.

She obtains fresh supplies from the blacksmiths in the nearby villages, and conducts her sales in cash and credit from her home, in the surrounding villages, and in the main market of Ségou, to a mostly female clientele.  With this loan, Madam Awa hopes to earn average monthly profits of 30,000FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and supply her family with grain.

loans.use: to purchase mortars and pestles

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio de 58 años de edad, casado desde hace 30 años con tres hijos de 22, 25 y 28 años de edad, vive en los caminos, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Don Antonio ha sido agricultor desde pequeño y hace 25 años que se dedica a su propia producción de café, el produce café pergamino húmedo, tiene una área de 5 manzanas de terreno. 
Inicio con la ayuda que le brindo la Cooperación Española y se ha motivado mucho por el buen precio que tiene en el mercado y genera buenas ganancias.
El préstamo que solicita es para invertirlo en siembra y mantenimiento de la finca de café, dándole una buena asistencia va a mejorar la producción con la que podrá darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 58, has been married for 30 years and has three children, ages 22, 25, and 28.  He lives in Los Caminos, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Antontio has been a farmer ever since he was little.  He has devoted himself to his own coffee production for 25 years.  He produces wet parchment coffee.  He has an area of five “manzanas” (a manzana is 7,000 square meters) of land.

He started with help from the Cooperación Española.  He has been very motivated by the good price at the market, and it generates good income.

The loan he is requesting is for planting and maintenance on his coffee farm.  Giving it good care will improve the production, and then he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to plant and for maintenance of his coffee farm.

location.town: Aldea los caminos, Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 48 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jesús, con quien se casó desde hace 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo vive con Cesar el último; en su casa propia ubicada en el anexo de San Lorenzo. Hace un año, falleció su hija producto de una enfermedad, para poder curarla tuvo que vender sus cuyes, se siente triste al recordarlo. Ahora tiene solo 38 ejemplares, pero está trabajando para aumentar y para ello quiere construir más posas donde vivirán. Pero no solo cría cuyes también vacas, toros y gallinas de buena calidad, de ahí obtiene ganancias por la venta de leche y de los animales. Además su esposo trabaja en el gobierno de su ciudad, donde la pagan un sueldo mensual. Ya los fines de semana los dos se dedican a la siembra de maíz y alfalfa en sus terrenos agrícolas propios, la alfalfa le ayuda en el alimento de sus hijos, pero el maíz lo comercializa en su misma chacra, ya que es de muy buena calidad y ya tienen compradores fijos. Ahora desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
María de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más cuyes, además de crear más corrales para que vivan.
texts.en: María, 48, is an admirable woman. She lives in the company of her husband, Jesus, who she married 25 years ago. They have three children but only Cesar, the youngest, lives with them in their own house located in the town of San Lorenzo. A year ago, their daughter died due to an illness. In order to care for her, they had to sell their guinea pigs. They feel sad upon recalling this. Now they have only 38 examples but they are working to expand and for this they want to build more places where they will live. They do not only raise guinea pigs but also cattle, bulls and hens of good quality. From this they obtain earnings from selling milk and animals. Additionally, her husband works in the city government where they pay him a monthly salary. On the weekends, the two of them are dedicated to planting maize and alfalfa in their own farm land. Alfalfa helps with feeding their children but the maize is sold in the same farm since it is very good quality and they already have fixed buyers. Now they wish to improve the infrastructure of their house. She belongs to the group "San Lorenzo" and this is the tenth loan with MFP so she hopes that a small loan can achieve her objectives. At the same time she promises to make her payments on time as she did with her previous loan. Additionally she is thankful to be part of her association because all of the members are responsible and united people. Maria, upon receiving your support, will invest the requested money in the purchase of more guinea pigs and build more pens in which they can live.

loans.use: to purchase more guinea pigs and build pens for them.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 38 years old and is married with two children who are 16 and 19 years old. She is from Nakuru. For the past three years, Rehema has operated a poultry business.

Rehema is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD to buy some chicks to rear and sell at a profit. In the future, she hopes to buy a lorry to help with her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Nyèmadion Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les six                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   femmes du groupe Nyèmadion en moyenne 26 ans, 2 enfants et habitent toutes dans la  commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de, voisinage, parenté et mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de mortiers, d’arachides grillées, de calebasses simples et gravées. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce pour certaines et d’avoir un fonds de commerce pour d’autres, les membres du groupe collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
 Madame Awa 1 ère de la gauche vers la droite est une grande vendeuse de calebasses gravées de belles figures dans le groupe. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 calebasses qu’elle gravera. Elle se ravitaille à la foire de Boussin et vend au comptant et à crédit à domicile, dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer et soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Married, mostly within polygamous families, the six women of the Nyèmadion Group are on average 26 years old, have two children, and live in the rural village of Sakoïba in the region of Ségou.  The women know each other as neighbors, through kinship and marriage.  They are small business women, selling mortars, roasted groundnuts, and gourds- plain and carved.

In order to increase the working capital for some, and obtain capital for others, the group members partnered with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their first group loan cycle.

Madam Awa, first from the left, is an established seller of beautiful engraved gourds.  She intends to use this loan to purchase 200 gourds which she will engrave.  She obtains her supplies from the market in Boussin and sells for cash and credit from her home, in the surrounding villages, and in the main market of Ségou, to a mostly female clientele.  With this loan, Madam Awa hopes to earn average monthly profits of 22,000FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and manage the household and health needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase gourds.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 59 años es una mujer sabia. Vive en compañía de Lucio, su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos a los que criaron con mucho amor; ahora ellos viven con su nieta en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Jauja. Ya no tiene hijos a quienes cuidar, todo ellos son grandes y maduros; se siente orgullosa. Pero tiene que trabajar junto a su esposo para poder mantenerse y no brindar preocupaciones además de criar a su nieta. El trabajo al que se dedica es la siembra de maíz, papa y alfalfa en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida constantemente, ya en la cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde tiene clientes fijos. Asimismo su esposo recibe una pensión por la jubilación de su trabajo, con el tiempo ahorro dinero para comprar un auto, ahora trabaja como taxista en el trasporte público entre dos ciudades cercanas, saco todo los permisos ahora solo le falta uno para poder trabajar con tranquilidad, obtiene buenas ganancias de su trabajo, porque es su propio auto y así obtiene mejores ingresos. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San Lorenzo” y este es el decimoprimero crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Reyna, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos y si el dinero le alcanza tramitará el seguro contra accidentes para su auto.
texts.en:
Reyna, 59, is a wise woman. She lives with Lucio, her husband of 17 years. They have 7 children whom they raised with much love and now they live with a granddaughter in a rented house in the city of Jauja.  Now she no longer has children to raise for they are all grown up and she is proud. But she has to work, together with her husband, in order to support herself and to avoid any worries aside from raising her granddaughter.

Reyna plants corn, potatoes and alfalfa on their own land, which she tends constantly since at harvest she markets the food at the wholesale market in the city where she has fixed customers. In addition, her husband receives a pension after retiring from his job. Over time, he saved money to buy an auto and now works as a taxi driver in public transportation between two nearby cities. He obtained all the permits, except for one, in order to be able to work in peace. He earns a good salary from his work because he owns the auto and thus gets a better profit.

Reyna belongs to the San Lorenzo Communal Bank and this is their eleventh loan with MFP. Consequently she hopes for a small loan so that she can meet her goals. She promises to make her payments on time, as she did with an earlier loan she had. As well, she likes being part of her bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. 

Upon receiving your support, Reyna will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizers to spread on her plants and if there is money left, she will take out accident insurance for their auto.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to take out accident insurance for her vehicle.

loans.name: Bianca

texts.en:
Bianca is 27 years old. She is from Migori county and is married to Charles. The couple doesn't have any children, but Bianca supports her two siblings. For the past three years, Bianca has operated a grocery in Migori town and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 

Bianca is requesting her first loan to buy a stock of rice, maize, and beans. She will use her profits to repay her loan. Bianca's dream is to increase her income to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize, and beans

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and is the mother of one child. For the past 11 years, she has been selling skirts and trousers to earn a living and she has employed one person. Since Mary joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

Mary is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy skirts and trousers to sell. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy skirts and trousers to sell

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.es: Crisanta, de 62 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Alejandro, su esposo desde hace 45 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos: Maycol, Rosy y Yandery; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Hualahoyo. Hace muchos años, ella se dedicaba a la agricultura, de ahí aprendió a trabajar y no rendirse, siempre fue independiente, pues su esposo trabajaba en una mina y llegaba a casa después de 15 días. Con el tiempo dejó de mantener a sus hijos y se centró en obtener un negocio propio, fue así que hace 4 años abrió su tienda de comestibles, donde vende carne, verduras, leche y demás productos, es muy conocida en su barrio. Además con la jubilación de su esposo, comenzaron a dedicarse al negocio de chompas, compraron las máquinas para que puedan tejer y emprendieron ese negocio. Al día tejen un promedio de 3 chompas, reciben constantemente pedidos de clientes de otras ciudades. Ahora ella se siente tranquila, pues en su vejes, tiene un ingreso económico del que vivir, sin dejar de criar sus animales, cuenta con cuyes, gallinas de buena calidad de las que consume y vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “nueva esperanza” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Crisanta de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda.
texts.en: Crisanta, is 62 years old and a hardworking woman. She lives with Alejandro, her husband of 45 years. They both have 8 children, but only live with 3 of them: Maycol, Rosy and Yandery. They care for them in their own home, located in the community next to Hualahoyo. Many years ago, she worked in agriculture, and there she learned to work and not give up. She was always independent, since her husband worked in a mine and would come home every two weeks. After time she finished raising her children and concentrated on getting her own business. That is why 4 years ago she opened her own food store where she sells meat, vegetables, milk and other products. She is very well known in her neighborhood. With her husband's retirement, they started to work in the business of sweaters. They bought the machines to knit with and began working in that business The make an average of 3 sweaters a day and they constantly get orders from customers in other cities. Now she is calm, because in her old age she has a financial income she can live on, while continuing to raise her animals. She has good quality guinea pigs and hens which she eats and sells when she needs to. She belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” support group and this is her second loan with MFP. She hopes for a small loan to be able to meet her goals. She also promises to make her payments as she dis with the previous loan. She also likes being a part of the association because all of the members are responsible and supportive. If Crisanta gets your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying basic necessity products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity products to stock her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 46 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Víctor su esposo desde hace 17 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con Fernando, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Hualahoyo. Hace algunos años comenzó a fabricar muebles para el hogar y puertas de madera de diversos diseños. Esto lo realiza en la capital, donde abrió un pequeño taller junto a sus hijos. Su esposo viaja ahí para ver como progresa el negocio. Les va muy bien tanto así que es el único sustento del hogar. Pero durante los días que regresa a casa aprovecha su tiempo para vender leña por millares, pues no le gusta estar inactivo, mientras tanto Elena aprovecha su tiempo criando animales menores como ovejas, gallinas, cuyes, los cuales después de criarlos los comercializa a la ciudad, ya que ahí tiene clientes fijos, “con esto ayudó en los gastos de comida y estudio de mi menor hijo”, afirma muy contenta. Ahora desea mejorar su taller y ahorrar dinero para implementar nuevas máquinas. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “nueva esperanza” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Elena de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias planchas de melamina, para realizar sus trabajos.
texts.en: Elena, 46, is a sensible woman. She lives in the company of Victor, her husband of 17 years. Together they have four children but only Fernando lives with them in their own house located in the town of Hualahoyo. A few years ago she began to make furniture for the home and wooden doors of different designs. She did this in the capital where she opened a small shop along with her children. Her husband traveled there to see the progress of the business. It's gone so very well that it is the only financial support for the home. But during the day, he returns home to take advantage of the time to sell wood by thousands since he doesn't like to be inactive. Meanwhile Elena takes advantage of her time raising young animals like sheep, hens, guinea pigs which, after raising them, she sells in the city since there she has fixed customers. "this helped with the food expenses and education of my youngest son" she affirms happily. Now she wishes to improve her shop and save money to buy new machines. She belongs to the "new hope" group and this is her ninth loan with MFP so she hopes a small loan can achieve her objectives. At the same time she promises to make her payments  as she did with her previous loan. Additionally, she is thankful to be part of her association because all of the members are responsible and united people. Elena, upon receiving your support will invest the requested money in the purchase of various melamine plates to complete her work.

loans.use: to purchase melamine plates.

loans.name: Munkhzaya

texts.en:
Munkhzaya is a 39-year-old mother of two children. She lives in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in an outer district without basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her specialties are as a builder and chef, but for the past five years, she has supported her family by operating a used clothing business at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. 

When Munkhzaya first began her business, she had 500,000 MNT as working capital. Now, she has about 3,700,000 MNT. Most of her customers are from poor families. Munkhzaya's husband works at local company and her son and daughter attend secondary school and kindergarten.  

Munkhzaya is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT loan to purchase more used clothes to sell and increase her working capital. In the future, she plans to build a new house on her current plot of land and improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is 33 years old and is married with two children who attend school. She owns rental houses in Mariakani and has been doing great as a landlady for the past year.

Zainabu is requesting her third loan from KADET LTD to purchase iron sheets, bricks, and cement to construct more houses to rent. She will use the anticipated profits from her loan to educate her children. Zainabu hopes to have many rental houses in Mariakani.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, bricks, and cement

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 42 years old and married. He is from Tkhilnari, West Georgia, and he lives with his family: his wife Leila; his three children ages two, nine, and 16; and his father. His older children got to school. Teimuraz earns his income from agriculture. His family owns a half-hectare plot of land where they grow fruit and vegetables that they sell to local greengrocers. The family also owns a small poultry farm and Teimuraz purchases chickens to raise and sell. His family's total average monthly income is 900 GEL.

Teimuraz is requesting a loan to purchase chickens to rear and sell in the spring. His loan will allow him to continue his poultry farm and increase his income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 46 years old from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married to Njeri. They have four children who are all in primary school.

John is a farmer and has cows that he sells and also gets milk for sale. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy another  dairy cow. He hopes to expand his business and make more profits.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 61 years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a dairy farm in Malindi and has been in the business for the last 13 years. She earns a monthly profit of 16,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her fifth loan of 100,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to buy more dairy cows for her business. 

She will save the anticipated profit to help take care of her children and her family. In the future, Peris hopes to grow her farm and do mixed farming.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en: Saraphina is a married woman. She has a son who is 20 years old. She describes herself to be a determined woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, kale, onions, etc.. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a fast-growing slum. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery store. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. Saraphina's business goal is to expand her grocery store and create job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old business lady in Mombasa. She is a married mother of five. She is a tailor, a business that she has been doing for the past 8 years. She is doing great. 

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD, to finance her business. She plans to purchase sewing threads and cloth materials. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing threads and cloth materials

loans.name: Beliter

texts.en: Beliter is 28 years old, married with two children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. She does farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 KES to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les quatre femmes du groupe Sabali ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la  commune rurale de Sakoïba dans la région de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de mortiers, de calebasses simples et gravées. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  prêt solidaire.
Madame Nêh 2ème de la droite vers la gauche a une grande réputation dans la vente des mortiers et pilons bien gravés avec de beaux dessins dans la commune et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 mortiers simples avec les forgerons afin de les graver du goût de la clientèle ou selon les instructions de la clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile, dans les villages environnants et au grand marché de Ségou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Nêh compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et à épargner. A l’instar des autres femmes du groupe, elle a pour objectif de pérenniser son activité dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sabali group, most of whom are married in monogamous families, have an average age of 28 years and 3 children. They all live in Sakoïba, a rural village in the Ségou region, and they met through family and marital ties.

The group members have a little business where they sell mortars, plain calabashes, and engraved calabashes. In order to increase their capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan.

Nêh, second from the right, is highly reputed in and around the village for selling nicely engraved mortars and pestles with beautiful patterns. She plans to use her loan to buy 100 plain mortars with blacksmiths in order to engrave them to the customers' tastes or according to the instructions of the customers. She sells them door to door in the surrounding villages and at the grand market of Ségou for cash or credit. Her customers are mainly women.

With this loan, Nêh expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in the business and saved. Like the other women in the group, her goal is to continue her business through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy calabashes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be determined, innovative and patient. He operates a garage where he provides motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in an urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying repair tools. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a body jerk worth 15,000 KES and the rest to improve his business. Joseph's business goal is to run a bigger garage and create more job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase a body jerk, worth 15,000 KES, and the rest to improve his garage business.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 42 years old. He lives in Lechkhumi District, in the western part of the country. Ramin is married and lives with his family: wife – Nona, three daughters (19, 16 and 3 years old), father and stepmother (retired). Ramin and Nona run a family agricultural business. They have a dairy farm with 5 milk cows. The family sells milk locally to dairy product retailers. They also own a 0.5 hectare cornfield, as well as 200 nut trees. Harvested corn and nuts are sold locally to the retailers as well. Total average monthly income of the family is 650 GEL, including the monthly pensions of Ramin’s parents.  

Ramin requested credit for expansion of the existing dairy farm building. In the future, he plans to increase the amount of milk cows on the farm. For implementation of this plan, the family needs to expand the farm building. After expansion of the family business their income will increase the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for expansion of the farm building

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is 26 years old. She is a mother of one child, age 5 years. Everlyne runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 KES to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and mangoes.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, oranges and mangoes.

loans.name: Suliko

texts.en:
Suliko is from the village Tsikhisdziri, West Georgia. He is 50 years old and lives with his family: wife – Patman and 25-year-old son. Suliko’s son works as an electrician in the village. Suliko and Patman are leading the family agricultural business.

The family owns a 0.2 hectare citrus garden and 100 nut trees. They sell harvested citrus and nuts on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 420 GEL. 

Suliko decided to export harvested citrus to a neighboring country (Armenia). According to his calculations, export will be more profitable than selling it on the local market, even taking into account transportation costs, which will be covered by requested credit. Suliko plans to use increased income for improving family living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for citrus transportation cost

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah is 46 years old, married with 4 children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He earns extra income from farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Jonah has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 KES to buy maize flour, sugar and tea leaves for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar and tea leaves for sale

loans.name: Ella Flore Charby

texts.fr:
Cliente  âgée de 39 ans, divorcée et mère de trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 21 ans.Elle se lance dans le commerce des sacs a mains et cartables il y'a bientôt 6 ans.
